Questions: Which unit is responsible for converting the data received from the user into a computer understandable format?
Explanation: The Input Unit converts the data, which the user enters into a language which the computer understands, i.e. it converts the data into binary format. The Output Unit is responsible for giving the results in user-understandable format. The Storage Unit is responsible for storing the data after immediate results of processing whereas; the ALU is responsible for various arithmetic and bitwise operations.

Questions: The only language which the computer understands is ______________
Explanation: The Computer understands only binary language which is written in the form of 0s & 1s. A computer can understand assembly language but an assembler is required which converts the assembly language to binary language. Similarly, for understanding high level languages, compilers/interpreters are required.

Questions: The smallest unit of data in computer is ________________
Explanation: A bit is defined as the smallest unit of data in a computer system. It is used as a short form of Binary Digit. A bit can have only two values 0 or 1. A nibble comprises of 4 bits, a byte is a collection of 8 bits whereas KB (Kilobyte) is equal to 1024 bytes.

Questions: One nibble is equivalent to how many bits?
Explanation: A nibble is defined as a unit of data which comprises of 4 binary digits or half of 8-bit byte. Therefore, 1 nibble = 4 bits. A bit is the smallest unit of data in a computer system. A byte = 8 bits, therefore, half of a byte=4 bits=a nibble.

Questions: Which of the following describes the correct format of an input instruction?
Explanation:
The input/output instructions are used to transfer information between external peripherals and the CPU. The correct format of an input instruction is: IN 8-bit port address.
Here, IN 82 is the correct option, where 82 is the designated port address. All the other options are invalid.

Questions:
The input machine which originated in the United States around 1880s is a ___________
a)
Explanation: A keyboard is an input device which originated in the 1880s and is used to give instructions to the computer in the form of letters and numbers. Mouse is used for the selection of various objects on the screen, joystick is mainly used for gaming purpose and bar code readers are used for reading the bar-codes.

Questions: What does the COMPUTER stand for?
A: Commonly Operated Machines Used in Technical and Educational Research
B: Commonly Occupied Machines Used in Technical and Educational Research
C: Commonly Operated Machines Used in Technical and Environmental Research
D: Commonly Oriented Machines Used in Technical and Educational Research
Explanation: The word COMPUTER is an abbreviation for the terms “Commonly Operated Machines Used in Technical and Educational Research”. The word COMPUTER also relates to the word COMPUTE which means to calculate. So, initially it was thought that a computer is a device which is used to perform calculations.
1 yottabyte is equal to 1024 ZB, which stands for zettabyte. Further, 1 ZB=1024 EB (exabyte) and and 1 EB=1024PB (petabyte).

Questions: Which of the following is not a function of the Input Unit?
A: It reads instructions and data from the outside world
B: It converts the data into computer acceptable format
C: It makes the data into user understandable format
D: It supplies the data and instructions to the computer for further processing
Explanation: The input unit converts the data into computer understandable format i.e. binary format and not the user understandable format. It is the duty of the output unit to make the data into user understandable format.

Questions: The process of producing useful information for the user is called ___________
Explanation: The Output Unit is responsible for giving the results to the user in the form of a printed report or visual display. The process is referred to as outputting. Controlling is nothing but the manner and sequence in which the instructions are being operated. Inputting means giving instructions to the system whereas, processing means performing certain operations and calculations.

Questions: VDU stands for __________
Explanation: A Visual Display unit is also referred to as the monitor who basically is used to give the results or outputs to the user. It comprises of a cathode ray tube internally.

Questions: What does SVGA stand for?
Explanation: Super Video Graphics Array is a type of Visual Display Unit. It supports 1024 by 768 pixels with 60,000 different colors.

Questions: The devices that used to give single or multiple colored images and drawings are ____________
Explanation: Plotters are the devices which are used to give colored images. They use ink pens or ink jets for drawing. Pens of different colors and shades are used for shading and styling.

Questions: A special request originated from some device to the CPU to acquire some of its time is called ___________
Explanation: An interrupt is a kind of request which takes control of the system bus for some time, then performs all the operations and gives back control to the CPU. It is usually identified by some number and is handled by the interrupt controller.

Questions: Line Printers that print one line at a time are _________
Explanation: The drum printers have a solid cylindrical drum with characters embossed on its surface in the form of circular bands. It can only print a predefined set of characters.

Questions: A ___________________ monitor looks like a television and are normally used with non-portable computer systems.
Explanation: A CRT (or the Cathode Ray Tube) Monitor looks like a television ideally. The flat panel monitors are thinner and lighter in comparison.

Questions: Which of the following is not a function of the Output Unit?
A: It produces results that can be easily understood by the user
B: It accepts the results produced by the computer
C: It supplies the data and instructions to the outside world
D: It supplies the data and instructions to the computer for further processing
Explanation: The output unit is responsible for giving the results to the user in the form of a printed report or visual display. It is not responsible for giving the instructions back to the CPU for processing.

Questions: PCI stands for _________
Explanation: PCI is a high-bandwidth bus that can function as a peripheral bus. Compared with others, it delivers better system performance.

Questions: Components that provide internal storage to the CPU are ______
Explanation: The Registers are the fast storage units. They are responsible for storing intermediate computational results in the CPU. The registers can be user accessible or inaccessible.

Questions: Saving data and instructions to make them readily available is the job of __________
Explanation: The storage unit is responsible for storing the data. It makes the instructions readily available for additional or initial processing whenever required. The cache is a software component that stores data to serve the data requests in future. It can contain the result of some earlier computations.

Questions: Which of the following is used to hold running program instructions?
Explanation: The primary storage is responsible for holding the data, intermediate results and the results of ongoing processes or jobs. Virtual storage is the main memory storage required for saving a large amount of data for future reference. The other options are invalid.

Questions: Which of the following is non-volatile storage?
Explanation: The secondary storage is the non-volatile storage unit because the data is not lost when the power supply is dissipated. Primary memory is the volatile memory.

Questions: Which of the following is used in main memory?
Explanation: DRAM stands for dynamic random access memory. It is denser than SDRAM (Static) and therefore it is used in the main memory. They are in the form of semiconductor RAMs.

Questions: Which of the following are types of ROMs?
C: Only one type there is no further classification
Explanation: There are two types of Read Only Memories: PROM i.e., Programmable ROM & EPROM i.e., Erasable Programmable ROM. When only a small number of ROMs with a particular memory content is needed, PROM is used and in case of EPROM, all the contents of the storage cells must be erased before the write operation.

Questions: RAID stands for __________
Explanation: RAID is a multiple-disk database design which is viewed as a single logical disk by the operating system. Data are distributed across the physical drives of the array. It guarantees the recovery of data in case of data failure.

Questions: A non-erasable disk that stores digitized audio information is _____
Explanation: A compact disk stores digitized audio information. The standard system uses 12 cm disks and can record more than 60 minutes of uninterrupted playing game.

Questions: The first practical form of Random Access Memory was the __________
Explanation: The first practical form of RAM was William’s Tube made in 1947. It stored data as electrically charged spots on the face of a Cathode Ray Tube.

Questions: The ‘heart’ of the processor which performs many different operations _____________
Explanation: The Arithmetic and logic unit performs all the basic operations of the computer system. It performs all the arithmetic(+,-,*,/,etc) as well as the logical operations( AND, OR, NOT, etc.).

Questions: Which of the following is not a bitwise operator?
Explanation:
All except the dot(.) operator are bitwise operators.
| : Bitwise OR
^ : Bitwise XOR
<< : Shift Left

Questions: The sign magnitude representation of -1 is __________
Explanation: The first leftmost bit i.e. the most significant bit in the sign magnitude represents if the number is positive or negative. If the MSB is 1, the number is negative else if it is 0, the number is positive. Here, +1=0001 and for -1=1001.

Questions: IEEE stands for ___________
D: Institute of Electrical and electronics engineers
Explanation: The IEEE is an organization of professionals in the field of electronics and electrical engineering. IEEE has given certain standards of its own which are followed in the field of computer science and electrical engineering.

Questions: The ALU gives the output of the operations and the output is stored in the ________
Explanation: Any output generated by the ALU gets stored in the registers. The registers are the temporary memory locations within the processor that are connected by signal paths to the CPU.

Questions: The process of division on memory spaces is called ______________
Explanation: The memory space is divided into segments of dynamic size. The programmer is aware of the segmentation and can reallocate the segments accordingly.

Questions: Number of bits in ALU is _________
Explanation: Arithmetic and Logic Unit consists of 16bits. They perform certain Arithmetic and bitwise operations (add, subtract, AND, OR, XOR, Increment, decrement, shift).

Questions: Which flag indicates the number of 1 bit that results from an operation?
Explanation: The parity flag indicates the number of 1 bit in any operation. The resultant bit is called the parity bit. The main aim of the parity bit is to check for errors.

Questions: The bitwise complement of 0 is ___________
Explanation:
Bitwise complement is basically used to convert all the 0 digits to 1 and the 1s to 0s.
So, for 0 = 00000000(in 8-bits) ::: 11111111(1s complement). The bitwise complement is often referred to as the 1s complement.

Questions: ___________ is the raw material used as input and __________ is the processed data obtained as output of data processing.
Explanation: Data can be assumed as a raw material which, in turns after processing gives the desired output in the form of instructions. Further, a set of ordered and meaningful instructions is known as a program.

Questions: Which of the following is not a characteristic of a computer?
Explanation:
The Computer system has no I.Q. of its own. It does only what it is programmed to do. It cannot take decisions of its own.
A computer is diligent because it can work continuously for hours without getting any errors or without getting grumbled.
The accuracy of a computer is consistently high and its level of accuracy depends on its design. A computer can perform any task if, it can be broken down into a series of logical steps. Therefore, a computer is versatile.

Questions: The part of a processor which contains hardware necessary to perform all the operations required by a computer:
Explanation:
A processor is a part of the computer which does all the data manipulation and decision making. A processor comprises of:
A data path which contains the hardware necessary to perform all the operations. A controller tells the data path what needs to be done.
The registers act as intermediate storage for the data.

Questions: What does MAR stand for?
Explanation: MAR is a type of register which is responsible for the fetch operation. MAR is connected to the address bus and it specifies the address for the read and write operations.

Questions: If the control signals are generated by combinational logic, then they are generated by a type of _______________ controlled unit.
Explanation:
The main task of a control unit is to generate control signals. There are two main types of control units:
A hardwired control unit generates control signals by using combinational logic circuits and the Micro programmed control unit generates control signals by using some softwares.

Questions: Which is the simplest method of implementing hardwired control unit?
Explanation:
There are 3 ways of implementing hardwired control unit:
A state table is the simplest method in which a number of circuits are designed based on the cells in the table.
A delay element method consists of a flowchart drawn for the circuit. A D-flip flop is used as a delay element.
A sequence counter method used k-modulo counter as a replacement for k delay elements.

Questions: A set of microinstructions for a single machine instruction is called ___________
Explanation: For every micro-operation, a set of microinstructions are written which indicate the control signals to be activated. A set of microinstructions is a micro program. The address of the next microinstruction is given by a Micro-program counter.

Questions: A decoder is required in case of a ______________
Explanation:
There are two types of microinstructions: Horizontal and Vertical.
In a horizontal microinstruction, each bit represents a signal to be activated whereas, in case of vertical microinstruction bits are decoded and, the decoder then produces signals.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of number system?
Explanation:
There are two main types of number systems : Positional & Non-positional.
Positional System uses digits for the representation whereas, non-positional number systems use certain symbols for the representation of numbers. Octal is a type of positional number systems with base 8.

Questions: How is the number 5 represented in non-positional number system?
Explanation: In a non-positional number system, 1 is represented as I, 2 as II, 3 as III, 4 as IIII and therefore, 5 is represented as IIIII. This number system uses symbols for the representation of digits.

Questions: The LSB and MSB of 1243247 are ____ and ____
Explanation: The LSB or the least significant bit is the rightmost digit at the zeros position. The MSB or the most significant bit is the leftmost digit.

Questions: . A device that uses positional notation to represent a decimal number.
Explanation: Abacus was used to doing arithmetic calculations around 2500 years ago. Pascaline was the pascal’s calculator by Blaise Pascal invented for doing laborious calculations.

Questions: The 2’s complement of 5 is ______________
Explanation: The 2’s complement is obtained by adding 1 to the 1s complement of a number. The 1’s complement of 5(0101) is 1010. For 2’s complement : 1010+1=1011.

Questions: What does BCD stand for?
Explanation: BCD is the binary coded decimal form of representation of numbers in 4 bits.E.g. The BCD representation of 5 is 0101. BCD representation of 22 is 00100010.

1 ZB=1024 EB(exabyte)
1 EB=1024PB(petabyte)
1 YB(yottabyte)=1024ZB.

Questions: Perfrom BCD addition: 2+3= _______________
ASCII stands for _____________________
A: American standard code for information interchange
B: American scientific code for information interchange
C: American scientific code for international interchange
D: American standard code of international interchange
Explanation: ASCII is an encoding standard which is used for communications worldwide. ASCII codes are allotted to digits, special characters and alphabets for data communication purpose.

Questions: The value of base in a decimal number system is ____________
Explanation:
A decimal number system consists of 10 digits from 0 to 9.
The definition of base describes it as a quantity to represent the number of digits present in that particular number system.
Therefore, here, the base is 10.

The base 2 represents that the number is binary ,whereas, the base 10 represents that it is to be converted to the decimal format.
Conversion: 22 * 1 + 21 * 1 + 20 *0 = 6.

Questions: The 2’s complement of 15 is ____________
Explanation:
2’s complement is obtained by adding 1 to the 1’s complement of the number.
Here, Binary of 15 = 1111
1’s complement of 15= 0000
2’s complement of 15= 0000+1=0001.

Questions: Another name for base is __________
Explanation:
Another name for base is radix. Base refers to the number of digits that a particular number system consists of.
The base of decimal number system is 10, binary is 2 and so on.

Questions: The decimal equivalent of (0.101)2 will be ____________
Explanation: Since the base is 2 , it could be easily guessed that the number is binary. Conversion: 2-1 * 1 + 2-2 * 0 + 2-3 * 1 = 0.625.

Questions: The signed magnitude for -3 will be ___________
Explanation:
Signed Magnitude of a number is a representation to determine if the number is positive or negative.
If the MSB of a number is 0, the number is positive, else if it is 1 the number is negative.
Here, +3 = 00000011
-3= 100000011.

Questions: The hexadecimal representation of 14 is _______________
Explanation:
The hexadecimal representations are as follows:
10 : A
11 : B
12 : C
13 : D
14 : E
15 : F.

Questions: Which of the following is not a decimal number?
Explanation:
All the numbers except 99.9A are decimal numbers.
This number has a hexadecimal component A in it, therefore , it is not a valid decimal number.
The decimal equivalent of A is 10.

Questions: Select the incorrect option:
B: G is valid in hexadecimal system.
D: The base of a decimal number system is 10.
Explanation: G is not a valid hexadecimal number. In this system, only representations from A to E are used to represent the numbers from 10 to 15. The base of the hexadecimal number system is 16.

Questions: Which of the following is not a positional number system?
Explanation:
The Roman number system isn’t a positional number system since it uses symbols to represent numbers.
The octal number system uses digits from 0-7, the binary number system uses digits from 0-1 whereas, the hexadecimal number system uses digits from 0-15.

Questions: The value of radix in binary number system is _____________
Explanation: In a binary number system, the value of base or radix is 2. The binary system uses only two digits for the representation of numbers, therefore its base id has chosen to be 2.

Questions: A computer language that is written in binary codes only is _____
Explanation: Machine Language is written in binary codes only. It can be easily understood by the computer and is very difficult for us to understand. A machine language, unlike other languages, requires no translators or interpreters.

Questions: The input hexadecimal representation of 1110 is _______________
Explanation:
In hexadecimal number system, 1110 = 15, which is represented by the alphabet E.
Some representations are:
A 10
B 11
C 12
D 13
E 14
F 15.

Questions: Convert the binary equivalent 10101 to its decimal equivalent.
Explanation:
To convert a binary number to its decimal equivalent follow these steps :
24 * 1 + 23 * 0 + 22 *1 + 21 * 0 + 20 * 1 = 21.
Therefore, the answer is 21.

Questions: Which of the following is not a binary number?
Explanation: A binary number can have only two possible digits, 0 and 1. In the third option, there is an alphabet E present which makes it an invalid binary number. Alphabets are only allowed in the hexadecimal number system.

Questions: Which of the following is the correct representation of a binary number?
Explanation:
The binary numbers should comprise only two digits 0 and 1.
Also, for the base, the value should be 2 and it should be written as a subscript enclosing the entire number. Here, the fourth option gives the correct representation.

Questions: The Octal Number System
Explanation: The maximum value in any number system is one less than the value of the base. The base in an octal number system is 8, therefore, the maximum value of the single digit is 7. It takes digits from 0 to 7.

Questions: The maximum number of bits sufficient to represent an octal number in binary is _______
Explanation: The octal number system comprises of only 8 digits. Hence, three bits (23 = 8) are sufficient to represent any octal number in the binary format.

Questions: The binary number 111 in octal format is ________________
Explanation:
Certain binary to octal representations are :
000=0
001=1
010=2
011=3
100=4
101=5
110=6
111=7.

Questions: Convert (22)8 into its corresponding decimal number.
Explanation:
To convert an octal number to decimal number:
81 * 2 + 80 * 2 = 16 + 2 = 18.
Hence, the decimal equivalent is 18.

Questions: Octal subtraction of (232)8 from (417)8 will give ______________
Explanation:
Octal subtraction is done as follows:
417
– 232
________
165
The octal subtraction is the same as that of any other number system. The only difference is, like in a decimal number system, we borrow a group of 10, in a binary system we borrow a group of 2, in an octal number system, we borrow in groups of 8.

Questions: The 1’s complement of 0.101 is _________________
Explanation:
The 1’s complement of a number is obtained by reversing the bits with value 1 to 0 and the bits with value 0 to 1.
Here, 0.101 gets converted to 1.010 in its 1’s complement format.

Questions: Express the decimal format of the signed binary number (10010)2
Explanation:
The first bit is the sign bit whereas the rest of the bits are magnitude bits. So the number is: 0010 = 21 * 1 =2
But, the sign bit is 1, Therefore the answer is : (-2)10.

Questions: What does the symbol D represent in a hexadecimal number system?
Explanation: The symbols A, B, C, D, E and F represent 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15 respectively in a hexadecimal system. This system comprises of 15 numbers in total: digits from 0-9 and symbols from A to F.

Questions: The maximum number of bits sufficient to represent a hexadecimal number in binary:
Explanation: The hexadecimal number system comprises of only 15 symbols: 10 digits and 5 symbols. Hence, three bits (24 = 16 ) are sufficient to represent any hexadecimal number in the binary format.

Questions: The binary number 1110 in hexadecimal format is _____________
Explanation:
Certain binary to hexadecimal representations are :
1010=A
1011=B
1100=C
1101=D
1110=E
1111=F.

Questions: Convert (52)16 into its decimal equivalent.
Explanation:
To convert a hexadecimal number to decimal number:
161 * 5 + 160 * 2 = 80 + 2 = 82
Hence, the decimal equivalent is 82.

Questions: Hexadecimal Addition of (3A5)16 and (1B2)16 will give :
Explanation:
Octal subtraction is done as follows:
3A5
+ 1B2
________
557
In hexadecimal addition of alphabets, we add the corresponding numbers they represent and then subtract the result from 16, then generate a carry of 1 to the next set of numbers.
Here, 5+2=7
A+B=10+11=21-16=5
3+1+1(carry)=5.

Questions: The 2’s complement of 10.11 :
Explanation: The 1’s complement of a number is obtained by reversing the bits with value 1 to 0 and the bits with value 0 to 1. Here, 10.11 gets converted to 01.00 in its 1’s complement format. Further, to convert 1’s complement into 2’s, we add 1 to the result. Here, 01.00+1=10.00.

Questions: What do we call the point(decimal) in any hexadecimal number of the form 111.A3?
Explanation:
The decimal is often referred to as the hexadecimal point in hexadecimal representation of numbers.
It is referred to as the octal point in octal numbers.

Questions: Which of the following is not a data type?
Explanation:
Data types are of three basic types: Numeric, Alphabetic and Alphanumeric. Numeric Data consists of only numbers.
Alphabetic Data consists of only letters and a blank character and alphanumeric data consists of symbols.

Questions: *@Ac# is a type of ________________ data.
Explanation: Alphanumeric data consists of symbols. Alphanumeric data may be a letter, either in uppercase or lowercase or some special symbols like #,^,*,(, etc.

Questions: Which of the following is not a valid representation in bits?
Explanation: There are no criteria like the 24-bit representation of numbers. Numbers can be written in 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit and 64-bit as per the IEEE format.

Questions: What are the entities whose values can be changed called?
Explanation: Variables are the data entities whose values can be changed. Constants have a fixed value. Tokens are the words which are easily identified by the compiler.

Questions: Which of the following is not a basic data type in C language?
Explanation:
There are 5 basic data types in C language: int, char, float, double, void.
Int is for the representation of integers, char is for strings and characters, float and double are for floating point numbers whereas void is a valueless special data type.

Questions: What does FORTRAN stands for?
Explanation: FORTRAN is a type of computer language. It was developed for solving mathematical and scientific problems. It is very commonly used among the scientific community.

Questions: The program written by the programmer in high level language is called _____________
Explanation: The program written by the programmer is called a source program. The program generated by the compiler after compilation is called an object program. The object program is in machine language.

Questions: A standardized language used for commercial applications.
Explanation: COBOL is a language used in business and commercial applications. It stands for Common Business Oriented Language. It is imperative, procedural as well as object oriented language.

Questions: ____________ define how the locations can be used.
Explanation: Attributes can determine how any location can be used. Attributes can be type, name, component, etc. Data objects are the variables and constants in a program.

Questions: A group of bits used to represent a symbol is called a ____________
Explanation: In binary coding, every symbol that appears in data is represented by a group of bits, which are called bytes. Computer codes use binary coding schemes.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of computer code?
Explanation: There is no coding scheme like EDIC. EBCDIC stands for Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code. BCD stands for Binary Coded Decimal. ASCII stands for American Standard Code for information interchange.

Questions: The BCD representation of (34)10 is _______________
Explanation:
BCD numbers are represented as:
34 = (0011 0100)BCD.
Each digit is individually taken and an equivalent standard 4 bit term is written for the respective digit.

Questions: Perform BCD addition of (23)BCD + (20)BCD .
Explanation:
To add any two BCD numbers :
Simply perform the addition : 23+20=43.
Then, write the equivalent BCD number = (0100 0011)BCD.

Questions: The weights used in Binary coded decimal code are:
Explanation: BCD is a weighted code and it uses the weights 8,4,2,1 respectively. It is often called the 8421 code. Since, it uses 4 bits for the representation therefore the weights are assigned as : 23 = 8, 22 = 4, 21 = 2, 20 = 1.

Questions: Write the decimal equivalent for (110001)BCD.
Explanation:
To obtain the decimal equivalent :
We start from the rightmost bit and make groups of 4, then write the decimal equivalent accordingly.
0011 0001 = (31)10.

Questions: . The 9’s complement of 45 is _____________
Explanation: The 9’s complement of a number is obtained by subtracting each digit from 9. Here, 99-45=54. Therefore, the 9’s complement is 54.

Questions: The 10’s complement of 455 is _________
Explanation:
To obtain the 10’s complement, we first obtain the 9’s complement and then add 1 to it.
999-455=544 (9’s)
544+1=545(10’s).

Questions: The Excess-3 representation of (0100)BCD is __________
Explanation:
The excess-3 code is obtained by adding 3 to the BCD code.
Here, 0100+0011=0111.
Also, 4+3=7.

Questions: What does EBCDIC stand for?
A: Extended Binary Converted Decimal Intermediate Code
B: Extended Binary Coded Decimal Intermediate Code
C: Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code
D: Extended Binary Converted Decimal Interchange Code
Explanation: EBCDIC is the Extended BCD interchange code. It uses 8 bits to represent a symbol. It can represent 256 different characters.

Questions: The EBCDIC code for the character A is ______________
Explanation: The character A is represented by the digit 1100 and the zone 0001. The hex representation for the same is C1. Similarly for B it is C2 and so on.

Questions: The hex representation for F is _______________
Explanation:
Certain hex representations are :
C1=A
C2=B
C3=D
C4=E
C5=F
C6=G
C7=H
C8=I
C9=J.

Questions: In EBCDIC, D5 is used to represent ________ character.
Explanation: D5 is used to represent N in this system. The representations D1 to D9 are used for the characters J to R respectively.

Questions: Which of the following is not a character of the digit 1110?
Explanation: All the alphabets from S to Z have their digit as 1110. Here, O has the digit 1101 and therefore is the incorrect option. Example: S has the digit as 1110 and zone 0010

Questions: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the digit 9?
Explanation:
For digits in EBCDIC, the hex equivalent starts from F0 to F9.
F0=0
F1=1
F2=2
F3=3 and so on.

Questions: The characters from 0 to 9 have their common digit as ___________
Explanation: The digits are 1111 in case of numbers. Here, 0.101 gets converted to 1.010 in its 1’s complement format.

Questions: The EBCDIC is mainly used in ___________
Explanation: This concept of EBCDIC was invented by IBM. It is mainly used in the IBM mainframe environment. So basically, mainframes use EBCDIC codes.

Questions: Which of the following character is available in EBCDIC but not in ASCII?
Explanation: The cent sign wasn’t available in ASCII which is the American Standard Code for Information interchange. It was available in EBCDIC though and thus was considered better.

Questions: What does ASCII stand for?
A: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
B: American Scientific Code for Information Interchange
C: American Scientific Code for Interchanging Information
D: American Standard Code for Interchanging Information
Explanation: The ASCII codes are used to represent the bits into symbols and vice versa. ASCII is the American Standard Code which is used to exchange information.

Questions: The decimal representation for the character ‘!’ in ASCII is ____________
Explanation:
The decimal representation of a few basic characters are:
33 : !
34 : ”
35: #
36 :$.

Questions: The two types of ASCII are _____________ and ____________
Explanation: The two types of ASCII are ASCII-7 and ASCII-8. ASCII-7 uses 7 bits for the representation of numbers and ASCII-8 uses 8-bits.

Questions: Any set of digits or alphabets are generally referred as ______________
Explanation: We refer to the digits and alphabets generally as characters. A character is generally a unit of information in computers.

Questions: The number of characters that can be represented in ASCII-8 are ______________
Explanation: ASCII-8 can represent 256 different characters. ASCII-8 uses 8-bits for the representation of numbers i.e. it can represent 28 = 256 different characters.

Questions: The zone of alphabetic characters from A to O in ASCII is _____________
Explanation: The zone used by ASCII for alphabets is 0100. For e.g. A is represented as 0100(zone)0001(digit). The hex equivalent is 41 for A. The zone used by numbers is 0011.

Questions: The representation of the number 8 in binary in ASCII-8 format _________
Explanation: The ASCII-8 format will have 8 bits. The zone for the character 8 is 0011 and the digit is 1000. Therefore, its representation is 00111000.

Questions: Binary Coding for the letter X is ______________
Explanation: The binary coding for the letter X is 01011000. Here, 0101 is the zone whereas 1000 is the digit. The alphabets from P to Z have the zone 0101.

Questions: . Express the ASCII equivalent of the signed binary number (00110010)2.
Explanation:
The ASCII characters for the remaining options are:
1 : 00110001
A : 01000001
, : 00101100.

Questions: The numbers used to represent numeric values in EBCDIC are _______
Explanation: Zoned numbers represent the numeric values under EBCDIC (Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code). In zoned format, there is only one digit per byte.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of numeric value in zoned format?
Explanation: The zoned format can represent numeric values of type Positive, negative and unsigned numbers. A sign indicator is used in the zone position of the rightmost digit.

Questions: The sign indicator of unsigned numbers is ____________
Explanation: A sign indicator is used in the zone position of the rightmost digit. A sign indicator C is used for positive, D for negative and F is used for negative numbers.

Questions: The EBCDIC value of the number 345 in zoned format is
Explanation: F is used for the representation of unsigned numbers therefore, F3F4F5 represents 345. F3F4C5 represents +345 . F3F4D5 represents -345.

Questions: Which of the following is a valid encoding format?
Explanation: The various encoding formats are UTF-8, UTF-16 and UTF-32. UTF stands for Unicode Transformation Format. It is basically an encoding system that supports all languages.

Questions: _________________ defines the assigned ordering among the characters used by the computer.
Explanation: Collating sequence is the term used for ordering among characters. It may vary depending upon the type of code used by a computer.

Questions: The sorting sequence of the strings A1,23,1A will be ______________
The default character coding in HTML-5 is _____________
Explanation: HTML5 which is the hypertext markup language generally uses the UTF-8 format as its default encoding. Unicode covers all the characters and symbols in all the different languages.

Questions: Numbers used in packed decimal format can be used for _____________ operations.
Explanation: The packed numbers can be used for arithmetic operations. The packed numbers also require the lesser number of bytes as compared to zoned numbers.

Questions: __________________ is a straightforward method of representing positive and negative numbers.
Explanation: Sign Magnitude is used for the representation of positive and negative numbers. If the leftmost digit is 0, the number is positive. If the leftmost digit is 1, the number is negative.

Questions: The 1’s complement of 1 in 4 bits is __________
Explanation: 1’s complement is obtained by reversing the bits from 0 to 1 and vice-versa. Binary of 1 is : 0001 and 1’s complement is : 1110.

Questions: The binary number 111 in its 2’s complement form is ____________
Explanation: complement is obtained by adding 1 to the 1’s complement. 1’s complement of 111: 000 and 2’s complement:001.

Questions: The sign magnitude representation of -9 is ___________
Explanation: In case of a negative number, the leftmost digit is 1 if the number is negative. Therefore, +9=00001001 and -9=10001001. Similarly for all other negative numbers.

Questions: If you are given a word of size n bits, the range of 2’s complement of binary numbers is ________
Explanation: 2’s complement is obtained by adding 1 to the 1’s complement. For e.g. 5 :0101 and 1’s complement=1010 and 2’s complement=1011.

Questions: In both signed magnitude and 2’s complement , positive and negative numbers are separated using ______________
Explanation: The positive and negative numbers are separated using the MSB. MSB is the Most Significant Bit. MSB is the leftmost bit. e.g. If 1000 is the number then 1 is the most significant bit.

Questions: Single Precision format comprises of _________ bits.
Explanation: The single precision format comprises of 32-bits. It has 1 sign bit, 8 bits for exponent and 23 for the mantissa.

Questions: If m is the 2’s complement and n is the binary number, then ______________
Explanation: 2’s complement is simply obtained by addition of 1. So if n is the number and we take the 2’s complement, add 1 to it, we get the 2’s complement. Therefore, m=n’+1.

Questions: The possible number of bit patterns with 8 bits ________________
Explanation: The total number of patterns that can be formed using n-bits are 2n. Here, possible patterns are: 28=256.

Questions: Which of the following is used for binary multiplication?
Explanation: The Booth’s Algorithm is used for the multiplication of binary numbers. It is basically used for the multiplication of 2 signed numbers. This is a very important algorithm in binary arithmetic.

Questions: The binary number obtained after applying RSC on 11010 will be ___________
Explanation: RSC stands for Right-Shift Circulant. So, whenever the numbers are shifted to the right an extra 0 bit is added to the left. Here, after the right shift of 11010, the number obtained will be 01101.

Questions: The result of >> of 11001 by 3-bits will be ______________
Explanation:
>> is the bitwise left shift operator in binary arithmetic.
Applying >>(left-shift) by 3-bits on the number 11001 will result in 3 zeroes on the right, i.e., 01000.

Questions: Booth’s Algorithm is applied on _____________
Explanation:
Booth’s Algorithm is applied only on signed and unsigned binary numbers.
Although, the values of other number systems can be converted to binary, and then the multiplication could be performed.

Questions: If Booth’s Multiplication is performed on the numbers 22*3, then what is 3 referred to as __________
Explanation: It is referred to as the multiplier. Multiplier is denoted by Q in booth’s algorithm. 22 is called the multiplicand. These numbers are first converted to their binary equivalents and further the multiplication is performed.

Questions: What is the default value of accumulator in booth’s multiplication of two 4-bit binary numbers?
Explanation: The correct answer is d because in case of Booth’s algorithm an extra bit is always added to the binary numbers. The 4-bit binary numbers become 5-bit numbers after adding the extra bit. Accumulator is always assigned 0 bits of the order of the binary numbers whose multiplication is to be performed.

Questions: What is the value of n in multiplication of 110* 1000?
Explanation: In Booth’s, n denotes the number of bits that the higher binary number has when multiplication is performed. Here, since there are 4 bits in 1000, the answer is n=4.

Questions: What will be the value obtained after multiplication of (-2) * (-3) using Booth’s Algorithm?
Explanation: After applying the procedure of Booth’s Algorithm, the value obtained will be 6. Even though the result is obtained in its 2’s complement for but then it is reconverted to its normalized form. Also, the value obtained after decimal multiplication is the same as the value obtained after binary multiplication.

Questions: What does the data transfer instruction STA stand for?
Explanation: STA is a data transfer instruction given whenever a value is to be copied on the accumulator. It is used for the fetch operation.

Questions: What is the 1’s complement of 11010?
Explanation: The 1’s complement of a number is obtained by converting all the 0 bits to 1 and all 1’s to 0’s. Here, 11010 gets converted to 00101.

Questions: The 10’s complement of 562 is ________
Explanation:
10’s complement is obtained by adding 1 to the 9’s complement of a number.
Here, 9’s complement=999-562=436.
Therefore, 10’s complement=436+1=437.

Questions: The 9’s complement of 6578 is ___________
Explanation:
9’s complement is obtained by subtracting 9 from each bit of the number.
Here, 9999-6578=3421.
Therefore, the 9’s complement is 3421.

Questions: >> operator is used to denote _________
Explanation:
>> operator denotes the right shift in binary arithmetic.
E.g. If we say, >>110 by 2-bits, the value obtained will be 001.
Similarly, << denotes the right shift operator.

Questions: The subtraction using 1’s complement of 110 – 100 will give the result ___________
Explanation:
To subtract using 1’s complement: Take the 1’s complement of the 2nd number (here, 011) and add it to the first number. (110+011=1,001).
If the carry is generated, it is added to the result (001+1=010).
If a carry is not generated then it is converted to its 1’s complement form.

Questions: The result obtained on subtraction using 2’s complement of 1111-0010 will be _________
Explanation:
Firstly, the 2’s complement of the 2nd number is obtained.
Then, if carry is generated, it is discarded and the number is positive.
Otherwise, 2’s complement of the result is obtained and the answer is negative.
Here, 1111+1110=1, 1101. Since carry is generated, it is discarded and the answer is positive.
The 1’s complement of a number is obtained by reversing the bits with value 1 to 0 and the bits with value 0 to 1. Here, 11111111110.101 gets converted to 000000001.010 in its 1’s complement format.

Questions: 7’s complement of 432 is _________________
Explanation:
To find the 7’s complement of any number, we simply subtract 7 from each of the bits.
Here, 777-432=345. So, the 7’s complement is 345.

Questions: The 16’s complement of 74E will be __________
Explanation:
The 16’s complement is obtained by subtracting 16 from each of the bits of that number.
Here, 16’s complement of 074E will be F8B2.

Questions: Binary addition of 1 + 1 gives the result ________
Explanation: The result obtained is 0 with a carry of 1. This carry obtained is added to the next higher column. Binary system can have only two numbers 0 and 1.

Questions: The result of 0 – 1 in binary is _
Explanation: The binary subtraction 0 – 1 gives the result 1. A borrow of 1 is although generated and is removed from the next higher column.

Questions: The complement of any number can be given by a general term _______________
Explanation:
Complement of a number can be given by the term :
C= Bn – 1 – N.
Here,
B= base
n= number of digits
N= the number.

Questions: The IEEE standard followed by almost all the computers for floating point arithmetic _____
Explanation: Most computers follow the IEEE 754 bit format for floating point arithmetic. IEEE stands for electrical and electronic engineers. It has all the floating point arithmetic specifications.

Questions: Which of the following is often called the double precision format?
Explanation: The 64-bit format is referred to as the double precision format. It has 1 sign bit, 8 exponent bits and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: What is NaN in IEEE standards?
Explanation: It stands for not a number in IEEE standards. A NaN is obtained whenever a result id indeterminate like whenever anything is divided by 0.

Questions: The result that is smaller than the smallest number obtained is referred to as ___________
Explanation: It is referred to as underflow. Nan stands for not a number. The mantissa is the part after the decimal.

Questions: The number of sign bits in a 32-bit IEEE format ________
Explanation: There is only 1 sign bit in all the standards. In a 32-bit format, there is 1 sign bit, 8 bits for the exponent and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: Express the decimal format of the signed binary number (101010)2 .
Explanation:
The first bit is the sign bit whereas the rest of the bits are magnitude bits. So the number is: 01010 =23 * 1 + 21 * 1 =8+2 =10.
But, the sign bit is 1 ,
Therefore the answer is : (-2)10.

Questions: Perform binary addition of 1101 + 0010 is ________
Explanation:
The addition is performed as :
1101
+ 0010
_______
1111
Therefore, the result is 1111.

Questions: The result of 0*1 in binary is ____________
Explanation: The binary multiplication of any number with 0 will give the result 0 itself. Any binary number when multiplied by 0 gives 0 only. e.g. 1101 * 0000 = 0000.

Questions: The multiplication of 110 * 111 is performed. What is a general term used for 111?
Explanation:
111 is called the multiplier.
Whenever a multiplication is performed the second term is called the multiplier whereas the first term is called the multiplicand.

Questions: The result obtained on binary multiplication of 1010 * 1100 is _____________
Which of the following is often called the double precision format?
Explanation: The 64-bit format is referred to as the double precision format. It has 1 sign bit, 8 exponent bits and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: What do you call the intermediate terms in binary multiplication?
Explanation: The intermediate terms are called partial terms. The mid terms obtained in the binary multiplications are the partial ones whereas the answer obtained is called the final product.

Questions: The result that is smaller than the smallest number obtained is referred to as ___________
Explanation: It is referred to as underflow. Nan stands for not a number. Mantissa is the part after the decimal.

Questions: The number of sign bits in a 32-bit IEEE format is _____
Explanation: There is only 1 sign bit in all the standards. In a 32-bit format, there is 1 sign bit, 8 bits for the exponent and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: Express the decimal format of the signed binary number (101010)2 .
Explanation:
The first bit is the sign bit whereas the rest of the bits are magnitude bits. So the number is: 01010 =23 * 1 + 21 * 1 =8+2 =10.
But , the sign bit is 1,
Therefore the answer is : (-2)10.

Questions: The number of values applicable in Boolean Algebra.
Explanation: Boolean algebra is based on binary number system. It therefore comprises only 2 bits : 0 and 1. Hence, only two values are applicable to Boolean algebra.

Questions: The symbol + in Boolean is also known as the ____________ operator.
Explanation: The symbol + is also called as the OR operator. It is used for logical addition. It follows the law of binary addition.

Questions: Which operator has the highest precedence?
Explanation: The NOT operator has the highest precedence. It is denoted by ! or – sign. Further, AND (.) operations are performed and then the OR terms are evaluated.

Questions: In the expression Y + X’.Y, which operator will be evaluated first?
Explanation: In Boolean Algebra, complement of a number is given the highest precedence. Therefore, complement which is denoted by the ‘ (apostrophe) symbol is evaluated first.

Questions: Which of the following is false?
Explanation: The first and second option describes the commutative law. The fourth option holds true since if x=1, then x’=0, and x+x’=1. Third option is incorrect because on multiplication of a boolean value with its complement the result will always be 0.

Questions: As per idempotent law, X + X will always be equal to ________
Explanation: It will always return the same value X. Since, boolean deals with only two numbers 0 and 1, if we add 0+0, the answer is 0. Similarly, if we add 1+1 the answer is 1.

Questions: The expression for involution law is _________
Explanation: The involution law states that the complement of complement of a number is the number itself. The third option justifies the statement. Thus, (x’)’=x.

Questions: Who proposed the use of Boolean algebra in the design of relay switching circuits?
Explanation: Claude E Shannon suggested the use of Boolean in relay switching circuits. George Boole, a mathematician introduced it for simplifying representations and manipulation of propositional logic.

Questions: Truth table is used to represent Boolean __________
Explanation: The Boolean functions are represented using the truth tables. Truth tables represent the tautology and fallacy for terms.

Questions: Boolean Function is of the form of ________
Explanation: The boolean function is of the form of algebraic expressions or truth table. A boolean function is of the form as that of option 2. The result obtained from a boolean function can be a truth value or a fallacy.

Questions: In the boolean function w=f(X,Y,Z), what is the RHS referred to as ________
Explanation: The RHS is commonly referred to as the expression. The symbols X, Y and Z are commonly referred to as the literals of the function.

Questions: The general form for calculating the number of rows in a truth table is ________
Explanation: The general form for the calculation of rows in a truth table is 2n . Here, n= number of literals in the function.

Questions: The number of literals in the expression F=X.Y’ + Z are _________
Explanation: Literals the generally the number of variables used in any boolean expression. Here, since there are 3 variables X, Y and Z, therefore the answer is 3.

Questions: The complement term for X’.Y’.Z + X.Y will be _____________
Explanation: The OR and AND operators are interchanged. The complement terms are reduced to normal terms and the result is obtained.

Questions: What is the complement of X’Y’Z?
Explanation: X+YZ

Questions: The minterm of any expression is denoted by ___________
Explanation: The variables forming an AND term is generally the minterm. It is denoted by m. (lower case letter).

Questions: The min term when X=Y=Z=0 is _____________
Explanation: There minterm expression is obtained using the AND term. Here, when X=Y=Z=0, the expression obtained is x’y’z’.

Questions: The max term when X=Y=Z=1 is ________
Explanation: The max term consists of variables forming an OR term. Here, when X=Y=Z=1, the expression is x’+y’+z’.

Questions: The terms in SOP are called ___________
Explanation:
The SOP is the sum of products. It consists of min terms often called the product terms.
Similarly, POS consists of max terms.

Questions: Which of the following is an incorrect SOP expression?
Explanation:
The second expression is incorrect because it consists of two maxterms ANDed together.
This makes it a POS or the product of sum expression.
Other options are valid SOP expressions.

Questions: The corresponding min term when x=0, y=0 and z=1.
Explanation:
The min term is obtained by taking the complement of the zero values and taking the term with value 1 as it is.
Here, x=0,y=0 and z=1, then the min term is x’y’z.

Questions: LSI stands for ___________
Explanation:
It stands for large scale integration. This is the abstraction level of the integrated circuits.
It can also be small scale, medium, large or very large scale integration.

Questions: Which operation is shown in the following expression: (X+Y’).(X+Z).(Z’+Y’)
Explanation:
The expression comprises of max terms.
Also, the terms are ANDed together, therefore it is a POS term.

Questions: The number of min terms for an expression comprising of 3 variables?
Explanation:
If any expression comprises of n variables, its corresponding min terms are given by 2n.
Here, n=3 since there are 3 variables therefore, min terms=23=8.

Questions: The number of cells in a K-map with n-variables.
Explanation:
K-map is nothing but Karnaugh map.
SOP and POS expressions can be simplified using the K-map.
The number of cells in case of n-variables=2n.

Questions: The output of AND gates in the SOP expression is connected using the ________ gate.
Explanation:
Since the product terms or the min terms are added in an SOP expression.
Therefore, the OR gate is used to connect the AND gates.

Questions: The expression A+BC is the reduced form of
Explanation:
The second option is correct.
It can simplified as follows: (A+B)(A+C)
=AA+AC+AB+BC
=A+AC+AB+BC
=A(1+C)+AB+BC
=A+AB+BC
=A(1+B)+BC
=A+BC.

Questions: Electronic circuits that operate on one or more input signals to produce standard output _______
Explanation:
The logic gates operate on one or more input signals to produce a standard output.
Logic gates give the output in the form of 0 and 1.
The Boolean algebra can be applied to the logic gates.

Questions: A __________ gate gives the output as 1 only if all the inputs signals are 1.
Explanation:
The AND gate gives a 1 only if all the input signals are 1.
The Boolean expression for evaluating an AND signal is: Y=A.B.

Questions: The boolean expression of an OR gate is _______
Explanation:
An OR gate gives the result as 1 if any one of the inputs is one.
Its expression is A+B.
An OR gate gives a 0 only if both the inputs are 0.

Questions: The gate which is used to reverse the output obtained is _____
Explanation:
NOT gate is used to reverse the output from 0 to 1 and vice-versa.
The Boolean expression for NOT gate is Y=A’.
Therefore, it gives the complement of the result obtained.

Questions: Which of the following gate will give a 0 when both of its inputs are 1?
Explanation:
The NAND gate gives 0 as the output when both of its inputs are 1 or any one of the input is 1.
It returns a 1 only if both the inputs are 0.

Questions: When logic gates are connected to form a gating/logic network it is called as a ______________ logic circuit.
Explanation:
It is referred to as a combinational circuit as it comprises a number of gates.
It is connected to evaluate a result of a Boolean expression.

Questions: The universal gate that can be used to implement any Boolean expression is __________
Explanation:
NAND gate can be used to implement any Boolean expression.
It is a universal gate. A universal gate can be used to implement any other Boolean function without using any other logic gate.

Questions: The gate which is called an inverter is called _________
Explanation: Inverter is used to reverse the output. A NOT gate is used to invert or change the output from 0 to 1 and vice-versa.

Questions: The expression of an EXOR gate is ____________
Explanation:
The expression for an EXOR gate is A’B+AB’.
An EXOR gate is nothing but an exclusive OR gate.

Questions: A ____________ is a circuit with only one output but can have multiple inputs.
Explanation:
A logic gate is used to evaluate a Boolean expression.
It can have multiple inputs but can have only one output.
The different types of logic gates are AND, OR, NOT etc.

Questions: The Output is LOW if any one of the inputs is HIGH in case of a _________ gate.
Explanation:
In case of a NAND gate the output is LOW if any one of the inputs is HIGH (i.e. 1).
It gives a HIGH output only in one case when all the inputs given to it are LOW.

Questions: The complement of the input given is obtained in case of:
Explanation:
The NOT gate, also called as the inverter gate is used to reverse the input which is given.
It gives an inverted output, thus gives the complement.
Expression for NOT gate: Y=A’, where A is the input.

Questions: How many AND gates are required to realize the following expression Y=AB+BC?
Explanation:
2 AND gates are required to realize the expression.
1 AND gate will be used to connect the inputs A and B whereas the other will be used to connect the inputs B and C.

Questions: Number of outputs in a half adder _____
Explanation:
A half adder gives two outputs.
One is called the sum and the other is carry.
Half adder can be implemented using an EXOR gate and an AND gate.

Questions: The ________ gate is an OR gate followed by a NOT gate.
Explanation:
A NOR gate is a universal gate which is an OR gate followed by a NOT gate.
It therefore reverses the output obtained by an OR gate.
It can be used to implement any Boolean expression.

Questions: The expression of a NAND gate is_______
Explanation:
A NAND gate is an AND gate followed by a NOT gate.
It therefore inverts the output of an AND gate.
NAND gate is also a universal gate.

Questions: Which of the following correctly describes the distributive law.
Explanation:
The second option correctly describes the distributive law.
(A+B).C =AC+BC.
Boolean Laws are used to implementing and simplifying Boolean expression.

Questions: Brain of computer is ____________
Explanation:
The CPU is referred to as the brain of a computer.
It consists of a control unit and the arithmetic and logic unit. It is responsible for performing all the processes and operations.

Questions: What does MBR stand for?
Explanation:
The binary subtraction 0 – 1 gives the result 1.
A borrow of 1 is although generated and is removed from the next higher column.

Questions: In the instruction ADD A, B, the answer gets stored in ___________
Explanation: In any instruction of the form ADD A, B; the answer gets stored in the A register. The format is: ADD Destination, Source.

Questions: What does PC stand for?
Explanation:
The Program counter contains the address of the next instruction which is to be fetched by the control unit.
All other options are invalid.

Questions: Which of the following holds the last instruction fetched?
Explanation:
The IR which stands for the instruction register contains the last instruction fetched.
All the others options are registers which are used for the fetch operation.

Questions: The portion of the processor which contains the hardware required to fetch the operations is _______
Explanation: The datapath contains the hardware required to fetch the operations. The control tells the data path what needs to be done.

Questions: Causing the CPU to step through a series of micro operations is called _________
Explanation: Sequencing is the process of causing the CPU to step through a series of micro operations. Execution causes the performance of each micro operation.

Questions: The functions of execution and sequencing are performed by using ______________
Explanation: Sequencing followed by the process of execution is performed by the Control signals. Sequencing is traversing each and every operation whereas execution causes the performance of each operation.

Questions: What does D in the D-flip flop stand for?
Explanation: In the hardwired control unit, the delay element method uses D-flip flop which causes a delay. Since, in the delay element method, there must be a finite time gap between the 2 steps.

Questions: CPU has built-in ability to execute a particular set of machine instructions, called as __________
Explanation: An instruction is any task which is to be performed by the processor. Instructions are stored in the register. Instruction set is the set of machine instructions.

Questions: The length of a register is called _______
Explanation:
The length of a register is called word size. It tells the number of bits a register can store.
Registers are a part of the CPU.

Questions: The _________ holds the contents of the accessed memory word.
Explanation:
The MBR holds the contents of the accessed (read/written) memory word.
MBR stands for Memory Buffer Register.

Questions: Which of the following is not a visible register?
Explanation: MAR or the memory address register is not a visible register. This register is user inaccessible. It contains the address of the memory block to be read or written to.

Questions: Which of the following is a data transfer instruction?
Explanation:
The instruction STA 16-bit address is a data transfer instruction.
STA means Store in Accumulator.

Questions: What is correct instruction if you want the control to go to the location 2000h?
Explanation: The JMP instruction is used to move to a particular location. In 8085 microprocessor, JMP statement tells the processor to go to location 2000h (here).

Questions: What kind of a flag is the sign flag?
Explanation: Sign flag is a type of status register or the flag register. It is used to indicate the sign of certain bits.

Questions: The number of sign bits in a 32-bit IEEE format ________
Explanation: There is only 1 sign bit in all the standards. In a 32-bit format, there is 1 sign bit, 8 bits for the exponent and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: New CPU whose instruction set includes the instruction set of its predecessor CPU is said to be ___________ with its predecessor.
Explanation: The CPU is called backward compatible since it contains the instruction set of its predecessor. Manufacturers tend to group their CPUs into families having similar instruction set.

Questions: What is the high speed memory between the main memory and the CPU called?
Explanation: Register Memory

Questions: Whenever the data is found in the cache memory it is called as _________
Explanation: Whenever the data is found in the cache memory, it is called as Cache HIT. CPU first checks in the cache memory since it is closest to the CPU.

Questions: LRU stands for ___________
Explanation: LRU stands for Least Recently Used. LRU is a type of replacement policy used by the cache memory.

Questions: When the data at a location in cache is different from the data located in the main memory, the cache is called _____________
Explanation: The cache is said to be inconsistent. Inconsistency must be avoided as it leads to serious data bugs.

Questions: Which of the following is not a write policy to avoid Cache Coherence?
Explanation: There is no policy which is called as the write within policy. The other three options are the write policies which are used to avoid cache coherence.

Questions: Which of the following is an efficient method of cache updating?
Explanation: Snoopy writes is the efficient method for updating the cache. In this case, the cache controller snoops or monitors the operations of other bus masters.

Questions: In ____________ mapping, the data can be mapped anywhere in the Cache Memory.
Explanation: This happens in the associative mapping. In this case, a block of data from the main memory can be mapped anywhere in the cache memory.

Questions: The number of sign bits in a 32-bit IEEE format is _____
Explanation: There is only 1 sign bit in all the standards. In a 32-bit format, there is 1 sign bit, 8 bits for the exponent and 23 bits for the mantissa.

Questions: The transfer between CPU and Cache is ______________
Explanation: The transfer is a word transfer. In the memory subsystem, word is transferred over the memory data bus and it typically has a width of a word or half-word.

Questions: Computer has a built-in system clock that emits millions of regularly spaced electric pulses per _____ called clock cycles.
Explanation: The regularly spaced electric pulses per second are referred to as the clock cycles. All the jobs performed by the processor are on the basis of clock cycles.

Questions: The operation that does not involves clock cycles is _________
Explanation:
Normally, several clock cycles are required to fetch, execute and decode a particular program.
Installation of a device is done by the system on its own.

Questions: The number of clock cycles per second is referred as ________
Explanation: The number of clock cycles per second is the clock speed. It is generally measured in gigahertz(109 cycles/sec) or megahertz (106 cycles/sec).

Questions: CISC stands for ____________
Explanation: CISC is a large instruction set computer. It has variable length instructions. It also has variety of addressing modes.

Questions: Which of the following processor has a fixed length of instructions?
Explanation: CISC is a large instruction set computer. It has variable length instructions. It also has variety of addressing modes.

Questions: Processor which is complex and expensive to produce is ________
Explanation: CISC stands for complex instruction set computer. It is mostly used in personal computers. It has a large instruction set and a variable length of instructions.

Questions: The architecture that uses a tighter coupling between the compiler and the processor is ____________
Explanation: EPIC stands for Explicitly parallel instruction computing. It has a tighter coupling between the compiler and the processor. It enables the compiler to extract maximum parallelism in the original code.

Questions: MAR stands for ___________
Explanation: The MAR stands for memory address register. It holds the address of the active memory location.

Questions: A circuitry that processes that responds to and processes the basic instructions that are required to drive a computer system is ________
Explanation: The processor is responsible for processing the basic instructions in order to drive a computer. The primary functions of a processor are fetch, decode and execute.

Questions: Any electronic holding place where data can be stored and retrieved later whenever required is ____________
Explanation: Memory is the place where data can be stored and later retrieved. Memory can be of classified into register, cache, main memory, etc.

Questions: Which of the following is the fastest means of memory access for CPU?
Explanation: Registers are the fastest means of access for CPU. Registers are the small memory locations which are present closest to the CPU.

Questions: The memory implemented using the semiconductor chips is _________
Explanation: The main memory is implemented using semiconductor chips. Main memory is located on the motherboard. It mainly consists of RAM and small amount of ROM.

Questions: Size of the ________ memory mainly depends on the size of the address bus.
Explanation: The size of the main memory depends on the size of the address bus of the CPU. The main memory mainly consists of RAM and ROM, where RAM contains the current data and programs and ROM contains permanent programs like BIOS.

Questions: Which of the following is independent of the address bus?
Explanation: The secondary memory is independent of the address bus. It increases the storage space. It is implemented in the form of magnetic storage devices.

Questions: ________ storage is a system where a robotic arm will connect or disconnect off-line mass storage media according to the computer operating system demands.
Explanation: The tertiary storage is the correct option. It is used in the realms of enterprise storage and scientific computing on large computer systems and business computer networks and is something a typical personal computer never sees firsthand.

Questions: What is the location of the internal registers of CPU?
Explanation: The internal registers are present on-chip. They are therefore present inside the CPU. L1 cache is also present on-chip inside the CPU.

Questions: MAR stands for ___________
Explanation: The MAR stands for memory address register. It holds the address of the active memory location.

Questions: If M denotes the number of memory locations and N denotes the word size, then an expression that denotes the storage capacity is ______________
Explanation: Storage capacity is the product of a number of memory locations that is the number of words and the word size or the number of bits stored per location. Storage capacity should be as large as possible.

Questions: Computer has a built-in system clock that emits millions of regularly spaced electric pulses per _____ called clock cycles.
Explanation: The regularly spaced electric pulses per second are referred to as the clock cycles. All the jobs performed by the processor are on the basis of clock cycles.

Questions: The operation that does not involves clock cycles is ____________
Explanation: Normally, several clock cycles are required to fetch, execute and decode a particular program. Installation of a device is done by the system on its own.

Questions: The number of clock cycles per second is referred as ______
Explanation: The number of clock cycles per second is the clock speed. It is generally measured in gigahertz(109 cycles/sec) or megahertz (106 cycles/sec).

Questions: CISC stands for ___________
Explanation: CISC is a large instruction set computer. It has variable length instructions. It also has a variety of addressing modes.

Questions: Which of the following processor has a fixed length of instructions?
Explanation: The RISC which stands for Reduced Instruction set computer has a fixed length of instructions. It has a small instruction set. Also has reduced references to memory to retrieve operands.

Questions: Processor which is complex and expensive to produce _________
Explanation: CISC stands for complex instruction set computer. It is mostly used in personal computers. It has a large instruction set and a variable length of instructions.

Questions: The architecture that uses a tighter coupling between the compiler and the processor.
Explanation: EPIC stands for Explicitly parallel instruction computing. It has a tighter coupling between the compiler and the processor. It enables the compiler to extract maximum parallelism in the original code.

Questions: HLDA stands for _______
Explanation: The HOLD signal is given to the CPU whenever an interrupt is to be served. If the CPU is ready to give the control of the bus, it gives the HLDA command which is Hold Acknowledgement.

Questions: Word length of a personal computer ___________
Explanation: The word length which is the size of a word is generally 8 bits in a personal computer. Word Size is generally the number of bits that can be processed in one go by the CPU.

Questions: ____________ is also called auxiliary storage.
Explanation: The secondary memory which allows us to store a large amount of data is often referred to as the auxiliary memory. It generally stores large amount of data on a permanent basis.

Questions: Magnetic tape is a type of _________ access device.
Explanation: Magnetic tapes are sequential access devices. They are the secondary storage devices and are used to store large amounts of data. In sequential access, data can be retrieved in the same sequence in which it is stored.

Questions: The magnetic tape is generally a plastic ribbon coated with ______
Explanation: Plastic ribbon is coated with a magnetizable recording material. Iron oxide and chromium dioxide is generally used in magnetic tapes. Data are recorded on the tape in the form of tiny invisible dots.

Questions: The dots on the magnetic tape represent ________
Explanation: The data recorded on the tape is the form of tiny invisible magnetized and non-magnetized spots (representing 1s and 0s) on its coated surface.

Questions: Which of the following is the correct representation for a storage capacity of a tape?
C: Storage capacity= Length * data recording density
D: Storage capacity= Length + data recording density
Explanation: Storage capacity is nothing but the product of length and the data recording density. Magnetic tape is commonly used sequential-access secondary device. Data recording density is measured in bytes per inch.

Questions: _________________ is the amount of data that can be stored on a given length of tape.
Explanation: Data recording density is the amount of data that can be stored on a given length of the tape. It is measured in bytes per inch. Bytes per inch=bpi.

Questions: The number of characters/second that can be transmitted to the memory from the tape is denoted by the term.
Explanation: Transfer rate measurement unit is bytes/second(bps). Value depends on the data recording density and the speed with which the tape travels under the read/write head.

Questions: The typical value of data transfer rate is __________
Explanation: Data transfer rate is defined as the number of characters per second that can be transmitted to the memory from tape. The typical value is 7.7 megabytes per second.

Questions: Tape drive is connected to and controlled by _______
Explanation: The tape drive is connected to and controlled by a tape controller that interprets the commands for operating the tape drive. Certain commonly used commands are read, write, erase tape, etc.

Questions: ______________ is used for writing/reading of data to/from a magnetic ribbon.
Explanation: The magnetic tape ribbon is used for the same. It has read/write heads for reading/writing of data on the tape. When processing is complete, the tape is removed from the tape drive for off-line storage.

Questions: The disk’s surface is divided into a number of invisible concentric circles called:
Explanation: The concentric circles are called as tracks. The tracks are numbered consecutively from outermost to innermost starting from zero. The number of tracks on a disk may be as few as 40 on small-capacity disks to several thousand on large capacity disks.

Questions: The number of sectors per track on a magnetic disk ________
Explanation: Each track of a disk is subdivided into sectors. There are 8 or more sectors per track. Disk drives are designed to read/write only whole sectors at a time.

Questions: Generally there are __________bytes in a sector.
Explanation: Each track of a disc is divided into sectors. A sector typically contains 512 bytes. Disk drives are designed to read/write only whole sectors at a time.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of disk address?
Explanation: Disk address represents the physical location of the record on the disk. It is comprised of the sector number, track number, and surface number (when double-sided disks are used).

Questions: What does CHS stand for?
Explanation: CHS stands for cylinder-head-sector. The scheme is called CHS addressing. The same is also referred to as disk geometry.

Questions: The interval between the instant a computer makes a request for the transfer of data from a disk system to the primary storage and the instance this operation is completed is called _________
Explanation: The interval is referred to as the disk arrival time. It depends on several parameters. Generally, a computer makes a request and the operation is served.

Questions: Disk access time does not depends on which of the following factors __________
Explanation: The disk access time depends on the seek time, latency and transfer rate. Wherein, seek time is the time required to position the read/write head over the desired track.

Questions: The time required to spin the desired sector under the read/write head, once the read/write head is positioned on the desired track.
Explanation: It is called latency. It is one of the factors on which the disk access time depends. Disk access time is the interval between the instant a request is made and the instance operation is completed.

Questions: A ____________ disk consists of a circular disk, which is coated with a thin metal or some other material that is highly reflective.
Explanation: Optical disks are highly reflective. They can be used to store extremely large amounts of data in a limited space.

Questions: The technology used in optical disks is ______
Explanation:
Laser beam technology is used in optical disks for recording or reading of data on the disk.
It is sometimes called the laser disk/optical laser disk due to the use of laser beam technology.

Questions: The storage capacity of an optical disk is given by:
A: Number of sectors * number of bytes per sector
B: Number of sectors * 2(number of bytes per sector)
C: Number of sectors * 3(number of bytes per sector)
D: Number of sectors * 0.5(number of bytes per sector)
Explanation: The storage capacity is given by the formula in option a. The most popular disk uses a disk of 5.25 inch diameter with a storage capacity of around 650 megabytes.

Questions: The tracks are divided into sectors whose size _______
Explanation: The tracks in an optical disk are divided into equal size sectors. Optical disk has one long spiral track, which starts at the outer edge and spirals inward to the center. Each sector is of the same length regardless of whether it is located near or away from the disk’s center.

Questions: CLV stands for, in terms of rotation of the optical disk ___
Explanation: It stands for constant linear velocity. The optical disk uses the CLV encoding scheme. Rotation speed depends on the radius of the disk.

Questions: The range of access times of optical disks is generally ______
Explanation: The access times of optical disks are typically in the range of 100 to 300 milliseconds and that of hard disks are in the range of 10 to 30 milliseconds.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of optical disk?
Explanation: The Winchester disk is a type of hard disk. Others are all optical disks. WORM is nothing but CD-R i.e., CD recordable. Stands for write once read many.

Questions: Winchester disks are a type of _______
Explanation: The regularly spaced electric pulses per second are referred to as the clock cycles. All the jobs performed by the processor are on the basis of clock cycles.

Questions: A plug and play storage device that simply plugs in the port of a computer is __________
Explanation: A flash drive often called as a pen drive enables easy transport of data from one computer to another. It comes in various shapes and sizes and may have different added features.

Questions: What does USB stand for?
Explanation: USB stands for universal serial bus. A flash drive simply plugs in the USB port of a computer.

Questions: A device similar to a flash drive ______________
Explanation: Memory card serves a similar purpose as that of a flash drive. It is in the shape of a card. Useful in electronic devices like Camera, music player, etc.

Questions: What does RAID stand for?
Explanation: RAID is Redundant array of independent disks. It is an array of disks which can store data bits.

Questions: A set of hard disk drives with a controller mounted in a single box, forming a single large storage unit is ____________
Explanation: The answer is disk array. It is commonly known as RAID. As a secondary storage device, provides enhanced performance, enhanced storage capacity and reliability.

Questions: The process in which a file is partitioned into smaller parts and different parts are stored in different disks is ____________
Explanation: Enhanced reliability is achieved by using techniques like mirroring and stripping in case of disk arrays. Stripping is the division of a large file into smaller parts and then storing them on different disks.

Questions: Which of the following uses multiple hard disk platters mounted on a single central shift?
Explanation: Disk packs use a number of hard disk platters. Also, they are mounted on a single central shaft.

Questions: Which of the following is not a magnetic disk?
Explanation: Flash drives are a type of memory storage devices. It is a relatively newer type of secondary storage device which enables easy transfer of data from one computer to another.

Questions: These devices provide a means of communication between a computer and outer world.
Explanation: The I/O i.e. the input/output devices provide a means of communication between the computer and the outer world. They are often referred to as the peripheral devices sometimes.

Questions: What does GUI stand for?
