Explanation: GUI stands for a graphical user interface. Graphical user interface basically provides a set of graphical elements on the screen to the users. Commonly used for point-and-draw devices.

Questions: Which of the following is not a point-and-draw device?
Explanation: All except the keypad are point-and-draw devices. They are used to rapidly point to and select a graphic icon or menu item from multiple options displayed on the GUI of a screen.

Questions: A device used for video games, flight simulators, training simulators and for controlling industrial robots.
Explanation: Joystick is the device used for the same. It is a point-and-draw device. It has a click button, a stick, a ball, a socket as well as a light indicator.

Questions: The unattended interactive information systems such as automatic teller machine or ATM is called as _________
Explanation: The term information kiosks are used for the same. Touch screens are used the most preferred human-computer interface used in information kiosks.

Questions: Which are the input devices that enable direct data entry into a computer system from source documents?
Explanation: They are referred to as data scanning devices. They eliminate the need to key in text data into the computer. It demands the high quality of input documents.

Questions: Which of the following is a type of image scanner?
Explanation: Image scanners are the input devices that translate the paper documents into an electronic format for storage in a computer. Stored image can be altered or manipulated with image-processing software.

Questions: Which of the following is capable of recognizing a pre-specified type of mark by pencil or pen?
Explanation: OMR stands for optical mark reader. These are very useful for grading tests with objective type questions or for any input data that is of choice or selection nature.

Questions: Input Devices that use a special ink that contains magnetizable particles of iron oxide are ____
Explanation: MICR reads data on cheques and sorts them for distribution to other banks or for further processing. MICR stands for Magnetic-Ink-Character Recognition

Questions: A printer that prints one line at a time and has a predefined set of characters is called _______
Explanation: The drum printers print one line at a time. They have a cylindrical drum with characters embossed on its surface in the form of circular bands.

Questions: Which of the following is a name of plotter as well as a printer?
Explanation: Drum is the name of a plotter as well as a printer. Drum printers have a predefined set of characters and print one line at a time. Drum plotters is an ideal device for architects and others who need to generate high-precision hard copy graphics output of widely varying sizes.

Questions: Name the device that converts text information into spoken sentences.
Explanation: A speech synthesizer converts text information into spoken sentences. It is used for reading out text information to blind people. Allowing people to communicate effectively.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of a digitizer?
Explanation: A digitizer consists of a digitizing tablet, a stylus in the form of a cross-hair cursor. A digitizer is used in the areas of GIS.

Questions: Which is the device used for converting maps, pictures and drawings into digital form for storage in computers?
Explanation: A digitizer serves the purpose given in the question. Digitizers are generally used in the area of Computer Aided Design by architects and engineers to design cars, buildings, etc.

Questions: The process in which a file is partitioned into smaller parts and different parts are stored in different disks is called _________
Explanation: Enhanced reliability is achieved by using techniques like mirroring and stripping in case of disk arrays. Stripping is the division of a large file into smaller parts and then storing them on different disks.

Questions: Which of the following Printers have a speed in the range of 40-300 characters per second?
Explanation: inkjetThe inkjet printers are non-impact printers. Hence, they cannot produce multiple copies of a document in a single printing. Can be both monochrome and color.

Questions: Which of the following is a temporary output?
Explanation: There are only two types of outputs: hard copy and soft copy. Soft copy output is temporary and vanishes after use. Hard copy output is permanent in nature and can be kept in paper files, etc.

Questions: Input Devices that use a special ink that is used for converting pictures, maps and drawings into digital format.
Explanation: The digitizer is used for digitizing pictures, maps and drawings into digital form for storage in computers. It is used in CAD by architects and engineers.

Questions: . A digitizer converts __________ input into digital input.
Explanation: A digitizer converts analog signals to digital images. Due to this, it is compatible with both scanners and mice.

Questions: Which of the following term is used when different forms of information like text, sound is converted to a binary code?
Explanation: Digitization is the term that is used. It converts the input which is in the form of an image, sound or text into a binary format and further makes it easier for the computer to understand and process

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a phase of digitization?
Explanation: There is no phase called analog conversion. Discretization means the reading of an analog signal. Quantization is the rounding of samples to numbers.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of a digitizer?
Explanation: A digitizer consists of a digitizing tablet, a stylus in the form of a cross-hair cursor. A digitizer is used in the areas of Geographical Information Systems.

Questions: The process of making digital information work for you is called ___________
Explanation: The process of making digitized data or information work for you is called digitalization. The conversion of analog signal to digital signal is called digitization. Digital signals are in the form of 0s and 1s.

Questions: What is the full form of FSM?
Explanation: FSM is Field Service Management. FSM soft wares are used for making proper use of the digitized information. Therefore, they are basically responsible for digitalization.

Questions: Which of the following Techniques are used to optimize field services?
Explanation: AI or Artificial Intelligence is optimizing the field services. It ensures that the fastest service is performed by the person in charge. Artificial intelligence is nothing but machine intelligence.

Questions: Obtaining services from a rapidly evolving group of internet users __________
Explanation: Crowd sourcing is the appropriate term which is to be used. Though human collaboration, outsourcing and computation mean the same. Crowd Sourcing means collaboration of a group of internet users for the same purpose.

Questions: What is the full form of TTS?
Explanation: TTS stands for Text to speech. It is a commonly used term with Speech Synthesis. Often called as text to speech synthesis.

Questions: A concept that contains rhythm of speech, stress patterns and intonation is ________
Explanation: Prosody is the correct term. It contains three main parts: the rhythm of speech, the stress patterns and the intonation. Intonation is a term used for the rise and fall when a person speaks.

Questions: Which of the following does not come under text analysis?
Explanation:
For TTS, the main concepts involved are :
01) Text Analysis
02) Phonetic Analysis
03) Prosodic Analysis
04) Speech Synthesis.

Questions: What is the medium to convert text information into spoken sentences?
Explanation: A speech synthesizer converts text information into spoken sentences. It is used for reading out text information to blind people. This allows people to communicate effectively.

Questions: Pitch and duration attachment comes under ____
Explanation: Pitch and duration attachment comes under Prosodic analysis. Other three terms are also used when we consider the text to speech conversion.

Questions: Which of the following is not a speech synthesis method?
Explanation: Summative isn’t a Speech Synthesis method. Formant Synthesis is the oldest method. Concatenative is the cut-and-paste method. Whereas, Articulative tries to model the human speech production mechanisms.

Questions: Speech Synthesis method based on the generation of periodic and non-periodic signals is ____________
Explanation: Formant synthesis is based on the same. It is based on the well known source-filter model whose idea is to generate periodic and non-periodic signals.

Questions: What is the full form of SAMPA?
Explanation: IPA(International phonetic association) contains some symbols that are complicated and cannot be found in typewriters. SAMPA is an example of alphabets which are compatible with computers and based on ASCII characters.

Questions: A speech synthesis model which tries to model the human speech production mechanisms is _________
Explanation: Articulative Synthesis tries to model the human speech production mechanisms. It is by far the most complicated speech synthesis method. Its implementation is difficult and therefore is not widely used.

Questions: The physical devices of a computer :
Explanation: Hardware refers to the physical devices of a computer system. Software refers to a collection of programs. A program is a sequence of instructions.

Questions: ___________ refer to renewing or changing components like increasing the main memory, or hard disk capacities, or adding speakers, or modems, etc.
Explanation: Upgrades is the right term to be used. Upgrades are installed to renew or implement a new feature. Except for upgrades, hardware is normally one-time expense.

Questions: Which of the following is designed to control the operations of a computer?
Explanation: Software is basically classified into two: System and application. System Software is designed to control the operations and extend the processing capability of a computer system.

Questions: Which of the following is not an example of system software?
Explanation: A system software is responsible for controlling the operations of a computer system. Word Processor is an application software since it is specific to its purpose.

Questions: A person who designs the programs in a software package is called;
Explanation: The programs included in a system software package are called system programs. The programmers who design them and prepare them are called system programmers.

Questions: ____________ is designed to solve a specific problem or to do a specific task.
Explanation: v An application software is specific to solving a specific problem. System software is designed for controlling the operations of a computer system.

Questions: Assembler is used as a translator for?
Explanation: Assembler is used in case of low level languages. It is generally used to make the binary code into an understandable format. Interpreter is used with the high level languages similarly.

Questions: What do you call a program in execution?
Explanation: Option Process is correct. A program is a set of instructions. A program in execution is called a process.

Questions: Which of the following is not a process state?
Explanation: There is no blocked state in a process model. The different states are ready, running, executing, waiting and terminated.

Questions: The software designed to perform a specific task:
Explanation: Software refers to a collection of programs. Software designed to do a specific task are referred to as the application software. Eg: Inventory management, banking, etc.

Questions: Developing software __________ means a major commitment of time, money and resources.
Explanation: Developing software in-house means the same. It is easier to carry out changes in the software if it is developed in-house

Questions: Which of the following is not a way of acquiring software?
Explanation: Duplication is not a correct way of acquiring the software. All the other options are valid. Apart from these, another option could be development of a customized software.

Questions: OSS stands for:
Explanation: OSS stands for open source software. OSS allows any user to download, view, modify and redistribute the software. Also, the user can fix bugs according to needs.

Questions: Public domain software is usually:
Explanation: The public domain software is generally community supported. It is community supported as author does not support users directly.

Questions: Set of programs which consist of full documentation.
Explanation: It is called a software package. A software is nothing but a collection of programs. A software package can solve a specific problem or perform a specific type of job.

Questions: Interpreter is used as a translator for __________
Explanation: It is generally used to make the code into an machine understandable format. Interpreter is used with the high level languages similarly. Assembler is used in case of low level languages.

Questions: What do you call a specific instruction designed to do a task?
Explanation: A program is a set of instructions. A command is given to do a specific job. A program in execution is called a process.

Questions: They normally interact with the system via user interface provided by the application software.
Explanation: Users interact with the system via user interface that is given by the application software. An application software is a set of instructions designed to serve a particular purpose.

Questions: The software substituted for hardware and stored in ROM.
Explanation: Software refers to a collection of programs. Firm wares act as a link between the hardware and the system. It is stored in read only memory.

Questions: A “glue” between client and server parts of application.
Explanation: A middleware acts as a glue between client and server parts of application. It provides programming abstraction which means hiding all the relevant details.

Questions: MOM stands for?
Explanation: MOM is message-oriented middleware. It is basically responsible for sending and receiving messages across distributed systems.

Questions: Storage of firmware is ___________
Explanation: Firmware is stored in ROM which is the read only memory. Firmware basically acts as a link between the hardware and the system.

Questions: DNS stands for?
Explanation: DNS stands for Domain Name System. Domain name system is the way in which the internet domain names are traced and then translated into IP addresses.

Questions: A software that lies between the OS and the applications running on it.
Explanation: It is called as middleware. Middleware enables the interaction between the Operating System and the applications running on it.

Questions: A type of middleware that allows for between the built-in applications and the real-time OS?
Explanation: It is called the embedded middleware since it activates the communication link between the built-in applications and the real time operating system.

Questions: What is the other name for object middleware?
Explanation: It is also called as object request broker. It gives the applications ability to send the objects and receive services through an object.

Questions: The _______ calls certain procedures on remote systems and is used to perform synchronous or asynchronous interactions between systems.
Explanation: It is called the RPC or the Remote Procedure Call. The functioning is to call certain procedures on remote applications. This is generally utilized in a software application.

Questions: A software that can be freely accessed and modified.
Explanation: Software refers to a collection of programs. OSS stands for Open Source Software. It can be freely accessed, edited and modified according to our needs.

Questions: PNG is a _________
Explanation: PNG is an image format. It stands for portable network graphics. PNG supports palette based images.

Questions: OSI stands for?
Explanation: OSI is open source initiative. It is a leading authority on OSS. OSS is a computer software distributed along with its source code.

Questions: Which of the following is not an open source software?
Explanation: MS-office is not open source software since its source code isn’t shared publicly. Others like Libre office, MySQL are open source softwares through which is distributed along with its source code.

Questions: The users must agree to the _______ terms and agreements when they use an open source software.
Explanation: The users must agree to the license terms and agreement in order to access an open source software. There is a limitation of OSS that the users cannot modify the terms and conditions of any software.

Questions: Which of the following is not a downside of OSS?
Explanation: An OSS is nothing but an open source software. It has restricted choices, i.e., there are fewer choices available for open source. Also, speed of change is an important downside, since the software keeps on updating itself, we cannot ensure if it is compatible with other applications.

Questions: An example of a web design OSS.
Explanation: Nvu is an example of an open source software for web designing. Others like KOffice, Open Office and AbiWorld are OSS examples for Office Automation.

Questions: An image editor similar to Adobe Photoshop.
Explanation: GIMPshop is an image editor similar to adobe photoshop. Nvu is intended for those with no technical expertise.

Questions: An OSS for communication purpose.
Explanation: Pidgin is used for Free Instant Messaging(IIM) client. Virtue mart and emart are for e-commerce purpose. Drupal is for content management.

Questions: A guideline for the OSS licenses other than the GPL.
Explanation: OSS is the open source software. In 1997, OSI or the open source initiative was founded and it developed the OSD (Open Source Definition). OSD is a guideline for OSS licenses other than the GPL.

Questions: Richard Stallman from MIT, established a special license, the ________ license.
Explanation: It was called the GNU license. It ensured that software is free and open to anyone. He was from MIT and his main motive was to develop a free alternative to Unix.

Questions: In 1969 AT&T laboratories developed ______ which supported and worked on different hardware platforms.
Explanation: Linux was found in that year. It worked well on different hardware platforms. Commercial users had to pay a license fee.

Questions: OSS stands for ___________
Explanation: OSS stands for open source software. OSS allows any user to download, view, modify and redistribute the software. Also, the user can fix bugs according to needs.

Questions: Public domain software is usually __________
Explanation: The public domain software is generally community supported. It is community supported as an author does not support users directly.

Questions: Set of a program which consists of full documentation.
Explanation: It is called a software package. Software is nothing but a collection of programs. A software package can solve a specific problem or perform a specific type of job.

Questions: Interpreter is used as a translator for?
Explanation: It is generally used to make the code into a machine understandable format. Interpreter is used with the high level languages similarly. Assembler is used in case of low level languages.

Questions: What do you call a specific instruction designed to do a task?
Explanation: A program is a set of instructions. A command is given to do a specific job. A program in execution is called a process.

Questions: They normally interact with the system via user interface provided by the application software.
Explanation: Users interact with the system via user interface that is given by the application software. Application software is a set of instructions designed to serve a particular purpose.

Questions: The word ____________comes from the name of a Persian mathematician Abu Ja’far Mohammed ibn-i Musa al Khowarizmi.
Explanation: The word algorithm comes from the name of a Persian mathematician Abu Ja’far Mohammed ibn-i Musa al Khowarizmi.

Questions: This characteristic often draws the line between what is feasible and what is impossible
Explanation: Algorithms help us to understand scalability. Performance often draws the line between what is feasible and what is impossible.

Questions: The time that depends on the input: an already sorted sequence that is easier to sort.
Explanation: The running time depends on the input: an already sorted sequence is easier to sort. The running time is given by the size of the input, since short sequences are easier to sort than the longer ones. Generally, we seek upper bounds on the running time, because it is reliable.

Questions:
Which of the following is incorrect?
Algorithms can be represented:
Explanation:
Representation of algorithms:
-As programs
-As flowcharts
-As pseudo codes.

Questions: When an algorithm is written in the form of a programming language, it becomes a _________
Explanation: An algorithm becomes a program when it is written in the form of a programming language. Thus, any program is an algorithm.

Questions: A system wherein items are added from one and removed from the other end.
Explanation: In a queue, the items are inserted from the rear end and deleted from the front end.

Questions: Another name for 1-D arrays.
Explanation: Linear arrays are the 1-Dimensional arrays wherein only one row is present and the items are inserted.

Questions: A data structure that follows the FIFO principle.
Explanation: The answer is Queue. A Queue follows the FIFO principle. FIFO stands for First In First Out.

Questions: The process of drawing a flowchart for an algorithm is called __________
Explanation: It is called as flowcharting. A flowchart is nothing but a pictorial representation of an algorithm.

Questions: Actual instructions in flowcharting are represented in __________
Explanation: The actual instructions are written in boxes. Boxes are connected by using arrows to indicate the exact flow of a flowchart and the order in which they are to be executed.

Questions: A box that can represent two different conditions.
Explanation: A diamond shape box denotes either a truth value or a false value. It jumps onto two different statements following it via flow lines.

Questions: A detailed flowchart is called ______
Explanation: A detailed flowchart or a flowchart with more details is called as micro flowchart. It represents all the components of the algorithm that is followed.

Questions: Which of the following is not an advantage of a flowchart?
Explanation: Flowcharts provide a proper documentation. It also provides systematic debugging.

Questions: A flowchart that outlines the main segments of a program.
Explanation: The answer is Macro Flowchart. A macro flowchart outlines the important components of a program. It therefore shows fewer details.

Questions: A ______________ is diagram that depicts the flow of a program.
Explanation: A flowchart is a diagram that helps us determine the flow of the program. Other options are irrelevant.

Questions: The operation represented by parallelograms.
Explanation: The input/output operations are represented by parallelograms. They generally are used to display messages during input and output part of a program.

Questions: Which of the following is not a flowchart structure?
Explanation:
There are basically four flowcharting structures:
• Decision
• Repetition
• Case
• Sequence.

Questions: The action performed by a ___________ structure must eventually cause the loop to terminate.
Explanation: The action performed by a repetition structure must eventually cause the loop to terminate. Otherwise, an infinite loop is created.

Questions: A _______ is a connector showing the relationship between the representative shapes.
Explanation: Arrows are the connectors that show the relationship between different shapes. They also show the flow of the program

Questions: Keep the statement language ______________ while writing a pseudo code.
Explanation: The statement’s language should be independent. Other rules are to write only one statement per line and end multiline structures.

Questions: Which of the following is not a keyword?
Explanation: Start is not a Keyword. Other words like read, write, if, else, etc are keywords and convey a special meaning.

Questions: ___________ is used to show hierarchy in a pseudo code.
Explanation:
Each design structure uses a particular indentation pattern.
Indentation should be considered in the following cases:
Sequence
Selection
Loop.

Questions: The statement that tells the computer to get a value from an input device and store it in a memory location.
Explanation: The READ statement is used to take the input. READ being a keyword should be in capital letters

Questions: ______ are identified by their addresses, we give them names (field names / variable names) using words
Explanation: Memory locations are identified by their addresses, we give them names (field names/variable names) using words descriptive to us such as ctr as opposed to a location addresses such as 19087.

Questions: ___________ begins with lower case letters.
Explanation: Variables begin with a lowercase. They contain no spaces. They also involve the consistent use of names.

Questions: ___________ begins with lower case letters.
Explanation: Variables begin with a lowercase. They contain no spaces. They also involve the consistent use of names.

Questions: Another notation for exponentiation.
Explanation: Double asterisk sign is also used for exponentiation. The general notation is ^ sign.

Questions: A symbol used for grouping.
Explanation: Parenthesis is used for grouping while working with fields. There are other symbols like *, +, -, **, etc.

Questions: A statement used to close the IF block.
Explanation: The answer is ENDIF. It is used to close the IF block. ENDIF statement should be in line with the IF statement.

Questions: Programming based on stepwise refinement process.
Explanation: Structured programming is based on the stepwise refinement process-a method of problem decomposition common to all engineering disciplines and the physical, chemical, and biological sciences.

Questions: A ________ is a directed graph that describes the flow of execution control of the program.
Explanation: A flowchart is a directed graph. It simply describes the flow of execution control of the program.

Questions: A program should be ________
Explanation: It is natural to write a program as a sequence of program structures such as sequences, choices and loops.

Questions: Which of the following is a loop statement?
Explanation:
WHILE is a loop statement.
Syntax : while(condition)
action.

Questions: What is the correct syntax of for statement?
Explanation:
The correct syntax is : for(initialization;condition;update)
For is another loop statement.

Questions: Semicolon is used after :
Explanation: Semicolon is used after function call otherwise it leads to compile-time errors. It shouldn’t be used after definitions. It should also not be used after loops.

Questions: The number of values a function can return at a time?
Explanation:
A function can return only one value at a time.
Syntax : return (x,12);

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a loop statement?
Explanation: The answer is elif. Elif isn’t a loop statement. It is a part of a choice statement.

Questions: The language made up of binary coded instructions.
Explanation: The language made up of binary coded instructions built into the hardware of a particular computer and used directly by the computer is machine language.

Questions: The ___________ contains the address of the next instruction to be executed.
Explanation: PC stands for program counter (It contains the address of the next instruction to be executed).

Questions: The memory unit is made up of _____ bytes.
Explanation: The memory unit is made up of 4,096 bytes. Memory unit is responsible for the storage of data. It is an important entity in the computer system.

Questions: A document that specifies how many times and with what data the program must be run in order to thoroughly test it.
Explanation: Test plan is the A document that specifies how many times and with what data the program must be run in order to thoroughly test it. It comes under testing.

Questions: An approach that designs test cases by looking at the allowable data values.
Explanation: Data coverage is the term used. It is responsible for designing the test cases.

Questions: The formal grammar rules governing the construction of valid instruction.
Explanation: Syntax determines the grammatical rules in a code. Semantics give meaning to the instructions.

Questions: A program that reads each of the instructions in mnemonic form and translates it into the machine-language equivalent.
Explanation: Assembler does this job. A language that uses mnemonic codes for the representation of machine-language instructions is called assembly language.

Questions: An approach that designs test cases by looking at the allowable data values.
Explanation: Data coverage is an approach that designs test cases by looking at the allowable data values. Code coverage is an approach that designs test cases by looking at the code.

Questions: The rules that give meaning to the instructions.
Explanation: The answer is semantics. They are the rules that give meaning to the instructions. The syntax is the formal rules that ensure validation of code.

Questions: Each personal computer has a _________ that manages the computer’s arithmetical, logical and control activities.
Explanation: Microprocessor handles all these activities. Each family of processors has its own set of instructions for handling various operations like getting input from keyboard, displaying information on a screen and performing various other jobs.

Questions: The data size of a word is _________
Explanation:
The processor supports the following data sizes:
• Word: a 2-byte data item
• Double word: a 4-byte (32 bit) data item, etc.

Questions: A direct reference of specific location.
Explanation:
There are two kinds of memory addresses:
• An absolute address – a direct reference of specific location.
• The segment address (or offset) – starting address of a memory segment with the offset value.

Questions: A Borland Turbo Assembler.
Explanation: Tasm is the borland turbo assembler. Nasm is used with linux generally. Gas is the GNU assembler.

Questions: The instructions that tell the assembler what to do.
Explanation: The executable instructions or simple instructions tell the processor what to do. Each instruction consists of an operation code (opcode). Each executable instruction generates one machine language instruction.

Questions: The segment containing data values passed to functions and procedures within the program.
Explanation: The stack segment contains data values passed to functions and procedures within the program. The code segment defines an area in memory that stores the instruction codes.

Questions: To speed up the processor operations, the processor includes some internal memory storage locations, called ___________
Explanation: The processor has some internal memory storage locations, known as registers. The registers stores data elements for processing without having to access memory.

Questions: To locate the exact location of data in memory, we need the starting address of the segment, which is found in the DS register and an offset value. This offset value is also called?
Explanation: When operands are specified in memory addressing mode, direct access to main memory, usually to the data segment, is required. This way of addressing results in slower processing of data. To get the exact location of data in memory, we need segment start address, which is found in the DS register and an offset value. This offset value is called an effective address.

Questions: Each byte of character is stored as its ASCII value in _______
Explanation: Assembly language deals with hexadecimal values only. Each decimal value is automatically converted to its 16-bit binary equivalent and stored as a hexadecimal number.

Questions: Prolog comes under ___________
Explanation: Prolog stands for Programming in Logic. The options mentioned are the four categories of programming. Prolog is a type of logic programming.

Questions: A program that can execute high-level language programs.
Explanation: Interpreter is a program that can execute high-level language programs “directly,” without first being translated into machine language.

Questions: Executables might be called ________
Explanation: The executables are sometimes called native code. HLL are translated to Machine language called the native code.

Questions: Source program is compiled to an intermediate form called ___________
Explanation: The Source program is compiled to an intermediate form called byte code. For each supported platform, write a “virtual machine” emulator that reads byte code and emulates its execution.

Questions: ________ is the assembly language for an imaginary architecture.
Explanation: Source program is compiled to an intermediate form – byte code. Byte code is the assembly language for an imaginary architecture.

Questions: JIT stands for?
Explanation: JIT stands for Just in time. JVMs actually compile each bytecode instruction to native code the first time it is used.

Questions: JVM stands for?
Explanation: JVM stands for Java Virtual Machine. Other related terms are JRE which is java runtime environment and JDK which is java development kit.

Questions: A language supported by MS. Net platform.
Explanation: C# is supported by MS. Net platform. JAVA was originally designed for web purposes.

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a characteristic of High level languages?
Explanation: HLL isn’t in machine language. It is converted to machine language for further processing.

Questions: Which is interpreted language?
Explanation: MATLAB is an interpreted language. All the other languages are compiled languages. In the case of Interpreted language, the translation to machine-language is performed incrementally at run-time.

Questions: The first widely-used high level language developed in 1957.
Explanation: Fortran which stands for Formula Translation was the first widely-used high level language. It was developed by IBM for scientific applications. The program was entered as punch cards.

Questions: A text file that contains our program is called as __________
Explanation: A file that contains the code or the main program is called as the source file. Source code must be processed by a compiler to create an executable file.

Questions: First statement in a fortran code is _________
Explanation:
It is the program statement. program statement is followed by the program name.
Syntax : program xyz

Questions: A Fortran is not ___________
Explanation: Fortran is not a case sensitive language. For e.g. PROGRAM xyz also works. Also, multiple consecutive blank spaces are ignored.

Questions: The delimiter in a FORTRAN code.
Explanation: Delimiter separates the tokens we use in our code. In a FORTRAN code, single blank space serves as a delimiter. Though, multiple blank spaces are ignored.

Questions: A program that reads the source code and converts it to a form usable by the computer.
Explanation: A compiler does this task. Internally, 3 steps are performed: preprocessing, checking and compiling. Further, assembler and linker do the work.

Questions: A valid variable declaration in FORTRAN is
Explanation:
A variable declaration has the following syntax:
Data type :: variable name

Questions: In FORTRAN, the declarations of variables can be modified using the _____ parameter.
Explanation: Kind can be used for this purpose. It can often be used for the precision of reals. If you want to change the precision, it can easily be done using one line of code.

Questions: COBOL stands for _________
Explanation: COBOL stands for Common Business Oriented Language. It is designed for business purpose. It is fast and relatively simple to learn.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of the program division in COBOL?
Explanation: COBOL has 4 basic parts in the division section: Identification, Environment, data and procedure. Each program is organized like a book.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of the Identification division?
Explanation:
The order of identification division is:
Paragraphs
Entries
Clauses.

Questions: D in COBOL stands for _________
Explanation: It stands for debugging lines. Compiler fills in with the sequence numbers. There are certain coding rules that must be followed in COBOL.

Questions: Comment in COBOL is denoted by ________
Explanation: Comment is denoted by asterisk. (*) It denotes the comment line. Hyphen – denotes continuation.

Questions: The data division is used to ________
Explanation: The data division is used to declare and create variables and constant fields. There are 3 basic data types in COBOL.

Questions: Which is not a data type in COBOL?
Explanation: There is no data type called as float in COBOL. It has only 3 basic data types: numeric, alphabetic and alphanumeric. Variables are created in the data division.

Questions: What does S denote in a picture clause?
Explanation: It denotes a sign in a picture clause. Picture clause values usually use 9, X, V, S, A.

Questions: _____________ denotes the format in which data is stored in memory.
Explanation: Usage denotes the format in which data is stored in the memory. Normally the phrase usage is omitted in COBOL.

Questions: Another name for white-box testing is ___________
Explanation: Sometimes it is called the glass box testing. It is a type of testing in which the internal structure of any application is tested and examined.

Questions: Which of the following divides the input domain into classes containing data?
Explanation: Equivalent partitioning divides the input domain into classes containing data. They basically exercise on a specific functionality of a software.

Questions: Which of the following is a common testing conducted by the developers?
Explanation: Unit testing is commonly performed by the developers. It is difficult to perform testing at any time during its cycle. An early start decreases the time and cost.

Questions: SDLC stands for ________
Explanation: It stands for Software development life cycle. In SDLC, the testing can be started from the software gathering requirement phase. And can be carried over till the deployment phase.

Questions: Which of the following is a myth in testing?
Explanation: Any user can test software is a myth. Anyone cannot test the software. A person who has no knowledge cannot test the software.

Questions: A process to determine how the actual testing is done _______
Explanation: Audit is the systematic process which can determine how the actual process of testing is done. Audit is generally done with a team.

Questions: Gathering formal or informal technical feedback is called _________
Explanation: The term used is inspection. Inspection helps in getting a formal or an informal feedback of a particular product. The errors can be easily examined.

Questions: Which is not involved in debugging?
Explanation: Testing is a different process and is different from debugging. Debugging involves identifying, isolating and fixation of the problems or errors.

Questions: A standard for unit testing.
Explanation: IEEE 1008 is a standard defined for unit testing. Rest all the other standards mentioned are invalid. There are certain standards defined for Quality assurance.

Questions: Examination of the program step by step is called ______________
Explanation: Debuggers perform the task of step by step examination of the code which is called stepping. They also perform tracing.

Questions: A freeware GNU Debugger is __________
Explanation: GDB is a free GNU debugger which runs on most of the Unix-like platforms. It works for multiple programming languages. GNU is free software.

Questions: Which of the following is written for getting help in GDB?
Explanation: In this h stands for help. h or help both commands can be used. Help lists all the commands.

Questions: h command gives ___________
A: A list of all the commands starting from h
C: Displays a short description of the command
Explanation: h command displays a short description of the command. If simply help is written it gives a list of all the commands.

Questions: _______ creates an inferior process that runs your program.
Explanation: run or r command creates an inferior process that runs your program. If there are no errors the program will finish and results will be displayed accordingly.

Questions: Which of the following does not affects the execution of the program?
Explanation:
Execution is affected by :
-> arguments
-> environment
-> Working directory
-> standard I/O.

Questions: ‘set args ‘ without arguments can ___________
Explanation:
initialize all the argumentsset args command can remove all the arguments.
Syntax: set args arg1 arg2 …
If the arguments are not given it deletes all the arguments.

Questions: Which is not involved in debugging?
Explanation: Testing is a different process and is different from debugging. Debugging involves identifying, isolating and fixation of the problems or errors.

Questions: run > outfile command is used to _________
A: direct output to the file outfile
Explanation: run > outfile directs the output to the file outfile. Certain commands like ‘ cd dir ‘ are used to change the working directory.

Questions: STD stands for ____________
Explanation: STD which stands for Software test documents is a part of Software Process Documentation. Several other terms used in documentation are SDP, SRS, etc.

Questions: ___ is part of user documentation.
Explanation: Installation guide is a part of user documentation. It also comprises of user manual, installation guide, Wiki and the online documentation and help.

Questions: The process of maintaining a record of project development and maintenance.
Explanation: It is called as process documentation only. It contains the plans, schedules, etc. It also contains the gantt chart.

Questions: This describes the objectives of a product and set out the constraints.
Explanation: Software development plan describes the objectives of the project and sets the constraints. It comprises risk analysis, work breakdown, monitoring and reporting mechanisms, etc.

Questions: _________ provide the detailed, specific application being developed.
Explanation: Appendices provide the detailed, specific application being developed. It includes hardware and database descriptions. Hardware requirements include minimal and optimal configurations of a system.

Questions: Which of the following should describe the technical terms used in the document?
Explanation: Glossary should describe the technical terms used in the document. In this, the writer shouldn’t make assumptions about the experience and expertise of the reader.

Questions: The services provided for the user are described in which section?
Explanation: The services provided by the software for the user are described in this section. The non-functional requirements should also be described in this section.

Questions: _____________ architecture provides a high-level overview of the anticipated system architecture.
Explanation: System architecture shows the description and distribution functions across system modules. Architectural components that are reused should be highlighted.

Questions: The graphical models showing the relationships between the system and its environment.
Explanation: System models describe the relationships between various entities. It comprises of various models like data flow, use case, semantic data models etc.

Questions: Maintenance and review add to the useful life of the system but can consume large amounts of __________
Explanation: They consume a large amount of resources. They can benefit from the methods and project management techniques though which are applied to the systems development.

Questions: This is not a part of the signing on the procedure.
Explanation: Signing on is a part of special system design considerations. It does not involve a step of execution. It involves identification, verification and authorization.

Questions: A __________ is a noted set of activities that are executed on the software in order to confirm its behavior to certain set of inputs.
Explanation: A test case is basically a documented set of activities that are carried out on the software in order to confirm its functionality to certain given inputs. Each test case would in turn have steps to address how we can check a particular test condition is satisfied or not.

Questions: A type of testing that is conducted at the software interface.
Explanation: Black box testing is conducted at the software interface. White box testing is predicted on close examination of procedural details.

Questions: A simple notation for the representation of control flow.
Explanation: The flow graph depicts logical control flow. Each circle in a flow graph is called a flow graph node, represents one or more procedural statements.

Questions: A software metric that provides a quantitative measure of the logical complexity of a program.
Explanation: The number of regions of the flow graph corresponds to the cyclomatic complexity. All other options are invalid.

Questions: An expression for the calculation of cyclomatic complexity.
Explanation: The option V(G) = E – N + 2 denotes the correct expression. Here, E is the number of flow graph edges. N is the number of flow graph nodes.

Questions: The probability of failure-free operation of a software application in a specified environment for a specified time.
Explanation: The answer is software reliability. It is estimated using historical and development data.

Questions: SCM stands for __________
Explanation: Software configuration management (SCM), also called change management, is a set of activities designed to manage change by identifying the work products that are likely to change.

Questions: ____________ is done in the development phase by the developers.
Explanation: Debugging is done in the development phase by the developer. In development phase developer fixes the bug (i.e) called debugging.

Questions: Process of evaluating a system to verify whether or not it is meeting its objectives.
Explanation: Process of evaluating a system (after it is put in operation) to verify whether or not it is meeting its objectives is called as system evaluation.

Questions: A point not considered in system evaluation.
Explanation:
Points considered for evaluating a system are:
-> Performance evaluation
-> Cost analysis
-> Time analysis
-> User satisfaction
-> Ease of modification
-> Failure rate.

Questions: A type of testing that is conducted at the software interface.
Explanation: Black box testing is conducted at the software interface. White box testing is predicated on close examination of procedural details.

Questions: Incorporating changes in an existing system to enhance, update, or upgrade its features.
Explanation: The Process of incorporating changes in an existing system to enhance, update, or upgrade its features is called system maintenance. On an average, maintenance cost of a computerized system is two to four times more than the initial development cost.

Questions: ________ Conducted at developer’s site.
Explanation: Alpha testing is conducted at the developer’s site. It is conducted by a customer (end users) in developer’s presence before software delivery.

Questions: __________ Conducted at customers’ site.
Explanation: Beta testing is conducted at the customer’s site. Generally, developer is not present. Customer records all problems (defects) and reports it to developer.

Questions: The probability of failure-free operation of a software application in a specified environment for a specified time.
Explanation: The answer is software reliability. It is estimated using historical and development data.

Questions: The probability that a software application is operating according to requirements at a given point in time.
Explanation: Software availability marks the proper functioning of the software at a given point of time. Reliability, availability and safety are three important factors.

Questions: A __________is a set of instructions which is prepared to perform a specific assignment if executed by a computer.
Explanation: A set of meaningful instructions is called a program. A program is basically designed to perform any function assigned to it.

Questions: What is responsible for creating a process from a program?
Explanation: OS is responsible for creating a process from a program. OS stands for operating system. A process is created in order to be executed by using computer facilities.

Questions: This cycle, of going through __________ states of running and input/output, may be repeated over and over until the job is completed
Explanation: The answer is process states. The cycle of going through process states can be repeated over and over again until the job is completed or the process gets aborted.

Questions: The wait fraction is represented by __________
Explanation: Wait fraction of a processor is represented by w. It is also known as the processor wait ratio.

Questions: Processor wait ratio is given by ________
Explanation:
Processor wait ratio is represented by w. It is given by :
w=b/b+e.

Questions: What does ‘b’ represent in a processor wait ratio?
Explanation: It represents the average I/O time. Average execution time with single programming is given by e.

Questions: A technique that allows more than one program to be ready for execution and provides the ability to switch from one process to another.
Explanation: Multiprogramming is the concept implemented for execution and provides the ability to switch from one task to the other.

Questions: Multiprogramming is mainly accomplished by:
Explanation: The OS is mainly responsible for multiprogramming. The hardware provides the specific circuitry that may be used by the operating system.

Questions: The technique that increases the system’s productivity.
Explanation: Multiprogramming increases the productivity. By increasing the CPU utilization other devices’s utilization is also increased.

Questions: Multithreading is also called as ____________
Explanation: Concurrency is often used in place of multithreading. Multitasking allows multiple threads to run at a time.

Questions: A single sequential flow of control within a program is ________
Explanation: A thread is a sequential flow of control within a program. Single-threaded program can handle one task at any time.

Questions: Both client and server release _________ connection after a page has been transferred.
Explanation: The answer is TCP. TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol. Servers receive requests from clients.

Questions: Java extension used in threads?
Explanation: java.lang.Thread is the class that is extended if any user wants to extend threads.

Questions: A method that must be overridden while extending threads.
Explanation: run()method must be overridden (It is similar to main method of sequential program).

Questions: An interface that is implemented while using threads.
Explanation: java.lang.Runnable is correct. Any thread class implements runnable.

Questions: A thread becomes non runnable when?
Explanation:
A thread becomes Not Runnable when one of these events occurs:
• Its sleep method is invoked.
• The thread calls the wait method to wait for a specific condition to be satisfied.
• The thread is blocking on I/O.

Questions: A method used to temporarily release time for other threads.
Explanation: We can use the yield() method to temporarily release time for other threads. It is static by default.

Questions: A method used to force one thread to wait for another thread to finish.
Explanation: The answer is join(). We can use the join() method to force one thread to wait for another thread to finish.

Questions: A task carried out by the OS and hardware to accommodate multiple processes in main memory.
Explanation: Memory management is carried out by the OS and hardware to accommodate multiple processes in main memory.

Questions: Secondary memory is the long term store for programs and data while main memory holds program and data currently in use. What kind of an organization is this?
Explanation: The secondary memory is the long term store for programs and data while main memory holds program and data currently in use. This is a physical organization.

Questions: Memory organization in which users write programs in modules with different characteristics.
Explanation: The answer is Logical. To handle user programs properly, the operating system and the hardware should support a basic form of module to provide protection and sharing.

Questions: An executing process must be loaded entirely in main memory. What kind of a memory organization is this?
Explanation: This is simple memory organisation. An executing process must be loaded entirely in main memory (if overlays are not used).

Questions: FTP stands for?
Explanation: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol. It is a type of internet service use for the transmission of files.

Questions: A set of overlapping divisions in the main memory are called _______
Explanation: Partition main memory into a set of non overlapping regions called partitions. Partitions can be of equal or unequal sizes.

Questions: Any program, no matter how small, occupies an entire partition. This is called ____________
Explanation: It is called as internal fragmentation. Main memory use is inefficient. Any program, no matter how small, occupies an entire partition. This is called internal fragmentation.

Questions: _________ is used to shift processes so they are contiguous and all free memory is in one block.
Explanation: Use compaction to shift processes so they are contiguous and all free memory is in one block.

Questions: __ searches for smallest block. The fragment left behind is small as possible.
Explanation: Best fit searches for the smallest block. The fragment left behind is as small as possible.

Questions: Separation of user logical memory and physical memory is ___________
Explanation: The separation of user logical memory and physical memory is called virtual memory. Only part of the program needs to be in memory for execution.

Questions: Virtual Memory can be implemented via __________
Explanation: Demand paging can implement virtual memory. Another way is demand segmentation.

Questions: COW stands for?
Explanation: COW stands for Copy over write. COW allows both parent and child processes to share the same pages initially.

Questions: LRU stands for?
Explanation: LRU stands for Least Recently used. LRU is least recently used. It replaces page with the smallest count.

Questions: An allocation that uses a proportional allocation scheme using priorities rather than size.
Explanation: Priority allocation uses a proportional allocation scheme using priorities rather than size.

Questions: A process selects a replacement frame from the set of all frames.
Explanation: Global replacement process selects a replacement frame from the set of all frames; one process can take a frame from another.

Questions: Any program, no matter how small, occupies an entire partition. This is called _____________
Explanation: It is called as internal fragmentation. Main memory use is inefficient. Any program, no matter how small, occupies an entire partition. This is called internal fragmentation.

Questions: A process is busy swapping pages in and out.
Explanation: Thrashing is the term used whenever a process is busy swapping pages in and put.

Questions: A basic element of data in a file.
Explanation: Fields are the basic elements of data in a file. e.g. student’s last name. It contains a single value.

Questions: ________________ refers to the logical structuring of records.
Explanation: File organisation refers to the logical structuring of records. It is determined bi the way in which files are accessed.

Questions: Which of the following is not an appropriate criterion for file organisation?
Explanation: The answer is Larger access time. The access time should be short. It is an important criteria for file organisation.

Questions: _________ itself is a file owned by the operating system
Explanation: Directory is the file owned by the operating system. File directory contains various important information.

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a part of the file directory?
Explanation: File directory contains important information like: Attributes, Location and Ownership.

Questions: Allocated size of a file comes under?
Explanation: Allocated size comes under the address information of a file. Address information consists of volume, starting address, size used and size allocated.

Questions: Which of the following is not a part of the usage information?
Explanation: Owner is a part of the access control information. Other options are a part of usage information of a file.

Questions: When access is granted to append or update a file to more than one user, the OS or file management system must enforce discipline. This is _________
Explanation: When access is granted to append or update a file to more than one user, the OS or file management system must enforce discipline. It is referred as simultaneous access.

Questions: The user can load and execute a program but cannot copy it. This process is?
Explanation: Execution is a process that user can load and execute a program but cannot copy it. Other processes are updation, changing protection, etc.

Questions: Category of software that comprises word processing, graphics, databases etc.
Explanation: Application software comprises of all these things like graphics, database, word processing softwares, etc. There are mainly two categories of softwares- System and application.

Questions: MS-Word comes under __________
Explanation: Ms- Word is an application based software. It comes under document production. Ms-Word, frontPage, Frame maker come under this category.

Questions: A ______________is an application that allows the user to compose and edit simple documents.
Explanation:
A word processor software is an application that allows the user to compose and edit all simple documents.
E.g. MS-Word.

Questions: In text documents, a structure which stays the same no matter how the document is represented.
Explanation: There are two basic structures- logical and physical. A logical structure stays the same no matter how the document is represented.

Questions: When the document gets put out : the best fit is calculated from ___________ structure.
Explanation: A logical structure stays the same no matter how the document is represented. The best fit is thus calculated from the logical structure.

Questions: This can change the physical structure of the document.
Explanation: Formatting can change the physical structure. It includes indentation, text color, style, etc. of the document.

Questions: An example of e-mail utility.
Explanation: Outlook is an example of email utility. Word is a word processor, Excel is a spreadsheet software.

Questions: A structure that is system- dependent.
Explanation: The correct option is physical. The physical structure of a document is system-dependent; i.e., fonts and tab spacing vary among systems.

Questions: The _____________ in a document and the order in which it is presented is referred to as the document’s logical structure.
Explanation: The information in a document and the order in which it is presented is referred to as the document’s logical structure. Information and the order are two most important things in a document.

Questions: In a spreadsheet, letters are used to represent _____________
Explanation: In any spreadsheet, the letters are used to represent columns. The numbers are used to represent rows.

Questions: A numeric data analysis tool that allows us to create a computerized ledger.
Explanation: A spreadsheet package is the numeric data analysis tool. It is useful for any numerical analysis problem whose data can be organized as rows and columns.

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a part of a spreadsheet?
Explanation: The answer is column number. There are no column numbers in a spreadsheet. Columns are represented using letters.

Questions: Spreadsheets cannot:
Explanation: Spreadsheets are not meant to create graphics. They can do all sorts of calculations, plot charts and graphs, etc.

Questions: _____________ help us to see patterns.
Explanation: Charts in spreadsheets give us a picture of our data. It can help us to see patterns as well.

Questions: An easier way to set up complicated calculations.
Explanation: Functions make it easier to set up complicated calculations. Various formulae can also be used.

Questions: The cell that is in use.
Explanation: It is called the active cell. The address of the active cell is shown in the formula bar.

Questions: The placement of information within a cell at the left edge, right edge, or centered is :
Explanation: The correct option is Alignment. The left, right and center positioning is defined by the alignment.

Questions: A change in the appearance of a value or label in a cell.
Explanation: Formatting is the term used whenever there are changes in the appearance of a value or label.

Questions: CAD stands for?
Explanation: CAD stands for Computer Aided Design. It is used in design of buildings, automobiles, aircrafts, etc.

Questions: Used to produce illustrations for reports or for generation of slides.
Explanation: The presentation graphics are used to produce illustrations for reports or generation of slides for use with projectors Commonly used to summarize financial, statistical, mathematical, scientific, economic data for research reports, managerial reports & customer information bulletins.

Questions: A graphics method in which one object is transformed into another.
Explanation: Morphing is a graphics method in which one object is transformed into another.

Questions: Producing graphical representations for scientific, engineering, and medical data sets.
Explanation: Scientific visualization is the term used for doing the same. It is used in various science related fields.

Questions: ____________applies techniques to modify or interpret existing pictures such as photographs and TV scans.
Explanation: Image processing is used in medical applications for picture enhancements, tomography, etc. It is also used to improve picture quality.

Questions:
A simple technique of X-ray photography.
It allows cross-sectional views of physiological systems to be displayed.
Explanation: Tomography can be Computed X-Ray or position emission tomography. It allows cross-sectional views of physiological systems to be displayed.

Questions: The major component of GUI.
Explanation: GUI stands for Graphical User Interface. The major component is the window manager. To make a particular window active, click in that window (using an interactive pointing device).

Questions: GKS stands for?
Explanation: GKS-Graphics Kernel System is the first graphics package. It was accepted by ISO & ANSI.

Questions: A set of libraries that provide programmatically access to some kind of graphics 2D functions.
Explanation: A set of libraries that provide programmatically access to some kind of graphics 2D functions comes under the graphics package. Their types are GKS, PHIGS, etc.

Questions: A package that allows individuals to use personal computers for storing and retrieving their personal information.
Explanation: It is a personal assistance package that allows for the same. It helps in planning and managing their schedules, contacts, finances and inventory of important terms.

Questions: PDA stands for?
Explanation: PDA stands for Personal digital assistants. They are generally hand held computers. They store, access and organize information.

Questions: You can expand the memory of some PDAs with ________ that can be inserted into the PDA.
Explanation: The answer is storage cards. You can expand memory of some PDAs with small storage cards that can be inserted into the PDA.

Questions: The devices that work the best with contact management.
Explanation: The palm pocket PC works best with contact management. The Palm Os is smaller, cheaper and have vastly better battery life.

Questions: MCTI stands for Mobile community ________ inventory.
Explanation: MCTI stands for Mobile community tree inventory. It is a freeware tree inventory software. It uses palm OS and windows platforms.

Questions: Forms that do not require any programming.
Explanation: The answer is hanDbase forms. The handBase forms do not require any programming. Pendragon forms can be used for a variety of applications like inventory for golf course.

Questions: The forms that can be used for a variety of inventory applications.
Explanation: The pendragon forms can be used for the same. It can be used for a variety of applications like inventory for golf course, street, park, etc.

Questions: Graphic object composed of patterns of lines, points, circles etc.
Explanation: A vector is a graphic object that can utilize various geometric shapes that can be represented using a few geometric parameters.

Questions: Graphics composed of patterns of dots called pixels.
Explanation: The answer is Raster. Patterns of dots are called pixels. The raster graphics are generally designed in such a way.

Questions: MFD stands for?
Explanation: MFD is Master File Directory. MFD lists names and characteristics of every file in volume. It also lists any subdirectories.

Questions: _________ is created when a user opens an account in the computer system.
Explanation: A subdirectory is created when a user opens an account in the computer system. It is treated as a file, though flagged in MFD as subdirectory.

Questions: A filename without path information
Explanation: The answer is Relative filename. A relative filename is a name without path information. It appears in the directory listings, folders.

Questions: Two or three characters appended to relative filename separated by a period.
Explanation: Extensions are added to filenames. The extensions help in identifying the file type.

Questions: Files that maintain the hierarchical structure of the file system.
Explanation: Directories are the files that maintain the hierarchical structure of the file system. The users are allowed to read information in directories.

Questions: Files in which users store information?
Explanation: The answer is Ordinary files. Users store information in ordinary files. Their protections is based on user requests and are related to various file functions.

Questions: The files that appear as entries in the directories.
Explanation: The special files appear as entries in the directories. They are the device drivers providing i/O hardware interface.

Questions: Number of regions of the disk in a UNIX files management system.
Explanation: There are 4 regions in which the disk is divided. The first is for booting, second contains the disk size, third includes the list of definitions and the remaining region contains the free blocks available.

Questions: Several instructions execution simultaneously in _________
Explanation: The answer is parallel processing. In parallel processing, the several instructions are executed simultaneously.

Questions: A collection of related data.
Explanation: Database is the collection of related data and its metadata organized in a structured format. It is designed for optimized information management.

Questions: DBMS manages the interaction between __________ and database.
Explanation: DBMS manages the interaction between the end users and the database. End users are the final users that interact with the database.

Questions: Which of the following is not involved in DBMS?
Explanation: HTML isn’t involved in Database Management System. Other things like the data and application request are a part of the DBMS.

Questions: Database is generally _________
Explanation: Database is user-centered. The perspective is that the user is always right. If there is a problem with the use of the system, the system is the problem, not the user.

Questions: A characteristic of an entity.
Explanation: An attribute is a characteristic of an entity. The association among the entities is described by the relationship.

Questions: The restrictions placed on the data
Explanation: Constraint is a restriction that is placed on the data. Attribute is the characteristic and the relation describes the association.

Questions: IMS stands for?
Explanation: IMS stands for Information Management System. It is developed to manage large amounts of data for complex projects.

Questions: A model developed by Hammer and Mc Leod in 1981.
Explanation: SDM stands for Semantic Data Model. It models both data and their relationships in a single structure.

Questions: Object=_________+relationships.
Explanation: The answer is entity. It is a part of OODBM (Object-Oriented Database Model). It maintains the advantages of ER-model but adds more features.

Questions: DBMS is a set of __________ to access the data.
Explanation: Database is a set of programs designed to access the data. It contains information about a particular enterprise.

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a level of abstraction?
Explanation: There are three levels of abstraction: physical, logical and the view level. These three levels are involved in DBMS.

Questions: A level that describes how a record is stored.
Explanation:
The answer is physical. The physical level describes how the record gets stored.
e.g. Customer.

Questions: The ______level helps application programs hide the details of data types.
Explanation: The application programs hide details of datatypes. Views can also hide information for security purposes.

Questions: A logical structure of the database.
Explanation: A schema is the logical structure of the database. e.g A set of customers and accounts and their relationship.

Questions: The actual content in the database at a particular point.
Explanation: The answer is Instance. Instance is the actual content of the database at a particular point of time.

Questions: Which of the following is not an object-based logical model?
Explanation: Network model is a part of record-based logical model and not object-based. Others are object based models. ER stands for Entity-relationship.

Questions: SQL is _______
Explanation: SQL or structured query language is a relational model. It comes under record-based logical models.

Questions: A level that describes data stored in a database and the relationships among the data.
Explanation: The answer is logical. The logical level describes the relationships between the data. Physical level describes how the data is stored.

Questions: A term that defines the direction of flow of information between devices.
Explanation: The term transmission mode defines the direction of flow of information between two communication devices. It tells the direction of signal flow.

Questions: Which of the following isn’t a type of transmission mode?
Explanation: There are three modes of transmission: simplex, half duplex and full duplex. Transmission modes tell the direction of signal flow between two devices.

Questions: A transmission that generally involves dedicated circuits.
Explanation: The answer is simplex. Simplex generally involves dedicated circuits. TV broadcasting is an example.

Questions: A transmission mode that can transmit data in both the directions but transmits in only one direction at a time.
Explanation: The half duplex mode supports two way traffic but only in one direction at a time. The interactive transmission of data within a time sharing system may be best suited to half-duplex lines.

Questions: A communication between a computer and a keyboard involves ____________ duplex transmission.
Explanation: It involves simplex duplex transmission. Another example of a simplex duplex transmission is loudspeaker system.

Questions: Telephone networks operate in this mode.
Explanation: Telephone networks operate in full duplex mode. It can transmit data in both the directions.

Questions: Fire alarms are based on this type of transmission:
Explanation: Analog transmission is a technique of transmitting voice, data, image, signal or video information. Fire alarm systems work in the same way.

Questions: A technique of transmitting data or images or videos (information) using a continuous signal.
Explanation: Explanation: Analog is a technique of transmitting data or images or videos (information) using a continuous signal, which varies in amplitude, phase or some other property.

Questions: A walkie-talkie operates in ____________
Explanation: A walkie-talkie operates in half duplex mode. It can only send or receive a transmission at any given time.

Questions: A coaxial cable has a bandwidth of _________ of megahertz.
Explanation: A coaxial cable has a bandwidth of 100’s of Mhz. Baseband speed is in a few KHz. Multiplexing improves channel bandwidth utilization.

Questions: The carrier wave is a _________
Explanation: The carrier wave is generally a sine wave. Carrier wave is used to transfer the signal from source to destination.

Questions: Controlling the phase is referred as __________
Explanation: It is referred to as phase modulation. When there is a change in amplitude, it is referred to as amplitude modulation.

Questions: A transmission mode that can transmit data in both the directions but transmits in only one direction at a time.
Explanation: The half duplex mode supports two way traffic but only in one direction at a time.

Questions: A multiplexing technique based on sampling.
Explanation: TDM which stands for Time division multiplexing is based on sampling which is a modulation technique.

Questions: An example of FDM:
Explanation: Broadcast radio is an example of FDM. This allows several messages to be translated from baseband.

Questions: FDM stands for?
Explanation: FDM stands for Frequency Division Multiplexing. This allows several messages to be translated from baseband, where they are all in the same frequency.

Questions: A modulation technique that improves channel bandwidth utilization.
Explanation: Multiplexing is a modulation technique that improves channel bandwidth utilization.

Questions: The purpose of communication system is to transfer information from _______ to the destination.
Explanation: The answer is source. A communication system transfers information from source to the destination.

Questions: WDM stands for?
Explanation: It stands for Wavelength division multiplexing. It has same general architecture as FDM. FDM is frequency division multiplexing.

Questions: In this type of multiplexing time slots are preassigned to sources and fixed.
Explanation: TDM is time division multiplexing. Data rate of medium exceeds data rate of digital signal to be transmitted.

Questions: Controlling the frequency is referred as _________
Explanation: It is referred to as frequency modulation. When there is a change in frequency, it is referred to as frequency modulation.

Questions: A technique that can be a solution to the problem of synchronizing data sources.
Explanation: Pulse stuffing is a technique that can be a solution to the problem of synchronizing data sources. In pulse stuffing, the outgoing data rate is higher than sum of incoming rates.

Questions: For voice, each channel contains a ___ word of digitized data.
Explanation: In digital carrier systems, for voice each channel contains one word of digitized data. The data rate is 1.544 Mbps. Five out of six frames have 8 bit PCM samples.

Questions: Many time slots are wasted in __________
Explanation: In Synchronous TDM, many time slots are wasted. Other techniques can help overcome this problem.

Questions: A technique that allocates time slots dynamically.
Explanation: Statistical TDM assigns time slots dynamically. They are allocated based on demand. Multiplexer scans input lines and collects data until the frame is full.

Questions: A system in which two channels are dedicated to transfer data.
Explanation: A cable modem has two dedicated channels from cable TV provider dedicated to data transfer. One in each direction.

Questions: In this technique, there is a link between subscriber and network and a local loop.
Explanation: In ASDL, there is a link between the subscriber and the network. It uses currently installed twisted pair cable.

Questions: A topology that is responsible for describing the geometric arrangement of components that make up the LAN.
Explanation: It is referred to as a physical LAN topology. LAN stands for Local Area Network.

Questions: ____ LAN topology describes the possible connections between pairs of networked end-points that can communicate.
Explanation: A logical LAN topology describes the possible connections. LAN stands for Local Area Network.

Questions: A term that refers to the way in which the nodes of a network are linked together.
Explanation: Topology is a term that refers to the way in which the nodes are connected. There are 4 major topology networks.

Questions: A network comprising o multiple topologies.
Explanation: A hybrid network consists of multiple topologies. It can comprise a ring, a star and other topologies. We call this arrangement as a hybrid network.

Questions: The participating computers in a network are referred to as:
Explanation: They are referred to as the nodes. There are several topologies designed for arrangements of these nodes like bus, star, etc.

Questions: A topology that involves Tokens.
Explanation: Ring topology involves sending and receiving of data with the help of tokens. Ring started out as a simple peer-to-peer LAN topology.

Questions: A ____________WAN can be developed using leased private lines or any other transmission facility
Explanation: A peer-to-peer WAN topology is a relatively simple way of interconnecting a small number of sites. It has the least-cost solution for WANs that contain a small number of internetworked locations.

Questions: A serially connected system of all the hubs of networks.
Explanation: The correct option is Daisy chain. This simple approach uses ports on existing hubs for interconnecting the hubs.

Questions: A piece of information which is sent along with the data to the source computer.
Explanation: Token is the information that is sent to the source computer along with the data. This token is then passed to the next node.

Questions: Configuration where many independent computer systems are connected.
Explanation: Distributed configuration has many systems connected, and messages, programs, etc are transmitted between cooperating computer systems.

Questions: Components used for interconnecting dissimilar networks that use different communication protocols.
Explanation: Gateways are used for this purpose. Gateways interconnect dissimilar networks, protocol conversion is performed by them.

Questions: A topology is a modified version of the basic star topology.
Explanation: A two-tiered topology is a modified version of the basic star topology. Rather than single concentrator routers, two or more routers are used.
