Questions: WANs that need to interconnect a very large number of sites.
Explanation: Wide Area Networks that need to interconnect a very large number of sites, or are built using smaller routers that can support only a few serial connections, may find the two-tiered architecture insufficiently scalable.

Questions: Components that operate at the network layer of the OSI model.
Explanation: They are referred to as the routers. They are used for interconnecting those networks that use the same high-level protocols above network layer.

Questions: A topology that involves Tokens.
Explanation: Ring topology involves sending and receiving of data with the help of tokens. Ring started out as a simple peer-to-peer LAN topology.

Questions: __________ operate at bottom two layers of the OSI model.
Explanation: Bridges operate at the bottom two layers of the OSI model. It connects networks that use the same communication protocols above data-link layer.

Questions: Connecting two or more networks to form a single network is called :
Explanation: Connecting two or more networks to form a single network is called internetworking and the resultant network is called internetwork.

Questions: OSI stands for?
Explanation: OSI is open system interconnection. It is a framework for defining standards for linking heterogeneous computers in a packet switched network.

Questions: ARPANET stands for?
Explanation: ARPANET stands for Advanced Research Project Agency Network. It was developed in late 1960s under ARPA (Advanced Research Projects Agency).

Questions: In this technique, there is no direct contact between users and their programs during execution.
Explanation: In the Batch Environment, there is no direct interaction between users and their programs during execution.

Questions: A technique that marked the beginning of computer communications.
Explanation: The answer is time sharing. In time sharing, Users were able to interact with the computer and could share its information processing resources.

Questions: A type of technique in which dumb terminals are connected to a central computer system.
Explanation: This happens in time sharing. In this, users were able to interact with the computer and could share its information processing resources.

Questions: TCP stands for?
Explanation: TCP stands for transmission control protocol. It basically allows different networks to interconnect.

Questions: The “Victorian internet” is actually?
Explanation: It was a telegraph. Invented in the 1840s. Used extensively by the U.S. Government.

Questions: Packet switching was invented in?
Explanation: Packet switching was developed in 1964. In packet switching, the message is broken into parts and then sent over independently.

Questions: The probability of failure-free operation of a software application in a specified environment for a specified time.
Explanation: The answer is software reliability. It is estimated using historical and development data.

Questions: DARPA stands for?
C: Data based Advanced Research Product Agency
Explanation: DARPA (Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency) contracted with BBN (Bolt, Beranek & Newman) to create ARPAnet.

Questions: A network that links many different types of computers all over the world.
Explanation: Internet is a network of computers that links many different types of computers. It is a network of network sharing a common mechanism for addressing computers.

Questions: A service that allows a user to log in into another computer somewhere on the Internet.
Explanation: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol. It is a type of internet service use for the transmission of files.

Questions: An internet service that allows the user to move a file.
Explanation: The answer is FTP. FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol. It allows the user to move a file from one computer to another on the internet.

Questions: Anonymous FTP files are called ___________ accessible files.
Explanation: Anonymous FTP files are called publicly accessible files because they can be accessed by any user on the Internet.

Questions: TCP stands for?
Explanation: TCP stands for transmission control protocol. It basically allows different networks to interconnect.

Questions: Any system that uses the HTTP protocol is called _________
Explanation: The system is the web server. HTTP stands for Hypertext transmission protocol.

Questions: Any computer that can access the server is called?
Explanation: Any computer that has access to the web server is called the web client. Web server is any computer that uses the HTTP protocol.

Questions: Allows the user to create and maintain a personal list of favorite URL addresses.
Explanation: Web Browsers help the user to maintain a personal favorite list of URLs. Also, allows the user to download information on various formats.

Questions: URL stands for?
Explanation: WWW specifies the URL of a website and allows the user to access information. URL stands for Uniform Resource Locator.

Questions: The web works on this model.
Explanation: Web works on the client server model. Client and server operate on machines which are able to communicate through a network.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of server?
Explanation: Browser is the answer. Browser is a type of client and it is not a server. File, web and name are the types of servers.

Questions: This determines the type of protocol to be used.
Explanation: The answer is <scheme>. In general, http is used. Others like file and ftp can also be used.

Questions: The location of file is determined by ________
Explanation: <pathname> tells the server where to find the file name. It is an important part of the URL format.

Questions: Apache is a type of ________
Explanation: Apache is a type of web server. It is an application which waits for client requests, fetches requested documents from disk and transmits them to the client.

Questions: A small data file in the browser.
Explanation: Cookie is a small data file in the browser. Most browsers nowadays allow the user to decide if they want the cookies or not.

Questions: Any computer that can access the server is called?
Explanation: Any computer that has access to the web server is called the web client. Web server is any computer that uses the HTTP protocol.

Questions: Allows the user to create and maintain a personal list of favorite URL addresses.
Explanation: Web Browsers help the user to maintain a personal favorite list of URLs. Also, allows the user to download information on various formats.

Questions: SGML stands for?
Explanation: HTML(Hypertext Markup language) is based on SGML. SGML stands for Standard Generalized Markup Language.

Questions: A program that can retrieve files from the world wide web and render text, images or sounds encoded in the files.
Explanation: A browser or a web browser is a program that can retrieve files from the world wide web. Certain examples are IE, Mozilla, etc.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of browser?
Explanation: Others except web are web browsers. Web is a type of server. Application that works on client requests.

Questions: Both client and server release _________ connection after a page has been transferred.
Explanation: The answer is TCP. TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol. Servers receive requests from clients.

Questions: In HTML, the tags that tell the browser how to display the page.
Explanation: Markup is a general term used to refer the types of tags in HTML. The markup tags tell the browser how to display the page.

Questions: FTP stands for?
Explanation: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol. It is a type of internet service use for the transmission of files.

Questions: A section in HTML that contains generic information about the document.
Explanation: The head segment contains a generic info about the document. The head section must come before the body section in an HTML document.

Questions: A tag similar to that of the italic tag.
Explanation: <cite> is a container tag in html that is citation generally in italics. Other tags like <em>or emphasize is also used for this purpose.

Questions: A _________ partitions a web browser window so that multiple web documents can be displayed simultaneously.
Explanation: A frameset partitions a web browser window so that multiple web documents can be displayed simultaneously. Frameset can have attributes like cols.

Questions: The _________ attribute specifies the web page to be placed in the frame initially.
Explanation: The src attribute or the source specifies the web page to be placed in the frame initially. It may be subsequently overwritten.

Questions: XML stands for?
Explanation: XML stands for Extensible Markup Language. It allows information to be shared among different computer systems on the Internet.

Questions: API is?
Explanation: API is the application programming interface. It is a set of instructions that allow the creation of applications.

Questions: GSM stands for?
Explanation: The answer is Global System for Mobile Telecommunications. It uses a variation of multiple access on the basis of time and is widely used in Europe.

Questions: IN stands for?
Explanation: IN stands for Intelligent Network. It is a telephone network that provides technical services.

Questions: FTP stands for?
Explanation: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol. It is a type of internet service use for the transmission of files.

Questions: PDU stands for?
Explanation: PDU stands for Protocol Data Unit. It is transmitted as a single unit to other units in a computer network.

Questions: A tag similar to that of the bold tag.
Explanation: <strong> is a container tag in html that is similar to bold. It makes the text more valuable as well as bold.

Questions: ISP is?
Explanation: ISR stands for Internet Service provider. It is a service that provides access to the internet.

Questions: NE stands for __________ element.
Explanation: The answer is network. NE is the network element. It is any logical entity.

Questions: _____________the ability to access, analyzes, evaluate and produce media.
Explanation: It is media literacy. It is the ability to access, analyze, evaluate and produce media. It is the process of becoming active, rather than passive, consumers of media.

Questions: The analysis of _________ is a process of deconstruction that investigates the operations of texts, their constructions, the ways they produce meanings, what those meanings may be.
Explanation: The analysis of texts is a process of deconstruction that investigates the operations of texts, their constructions, the ways they produce meanings, what those meanings may be. However, they also warn of the dangers of making assumptions about the validity of any one analytic method.

Questions: A type of analysis that attends to the repetition and frequency of features, their proportions within the text, and consequent assumptions about significance.
Explanation: The answer is Content. Linguistic analysis might concentrate on the potential effects of style of address. Content analysis attends to the repetition and frequency of features, their proportions within the text, and consequent assumptions about significance.

Questions: ______ analysis regards texts as collections of signs or paradigms and possible meanings, operating within the bounds of various codes.
Explanation: Semiotic analysis regards texts as collections of signs or paradigms and possible meanings, operating within the bounds of various codes.

Questions: This part of image analysis refers to those primary signs, often part of the technique of photography, which are about how the image is made.=
Explanation: Treatment in image analysis refers to those primary signs, often part of the technique of photography, which is about how the image is made.

Questions: In image analysis, this part refers to objects represented within the image, which may signify to us because of, for example, their symbolic power or because of their composition in relation to each other.
Explanation: Content refers to objects represented within the image. Treatment in image analysis refers to those primary signs, often part of the technique of photography, which are about how the image is made.

Questions: ___ are about storytelling and story meaning.
Explanation: Narratives are about storytelling and story meaning. Media texts tell stories; they have a narrative.

Questions: __________ describes the effect of involving the reader with the story, of constructing it as truth.
Explanation: Identification describes the effect of involving the reader with the story, of constructing it as truth. It produces a meaning of truth, a belief in the validity of the text and of all the other meanings that we make from it.

Questions: The notion of norms also links to the idea that representations are given force through a process of:
Explanation: The notion of norms also links to the idea that representations are given force through a process of naturalization.

Questions: The media texts may throw up discourses and are called ____________
Explanation: Some texts may also throw up discourses and their meanings if you attend to what are called binary oppositions. The discourse is also marked by what it is not, by what it is opposed to.

Questions: The notion of __________ is one which is especially associated with semiotics and with genres.
Explanation: The notion of codes is one which is especially associated with semiotics and with genres. The textual codes may be summarized into: written, spoken, non-verbal and visual.

Questions: The idea of _________is central to understanding the production of meaning through texts.
Explanation: The idea of representation is central to understanding the production of meaning through texts. Texts are nothing but representations in both a material and an ideological sense.

Questions: ICT stands for?
Explanation: ICT stands for Information, Communication and Technology. ICT is responsible for providing access to information.

Questions: A system of interlinked documents, websites, portals etc. accessed through the Internet.
Explanation: World Wide Web a system of interlinked documents, websites, portals etc. accessed through the Internet. Since these links are not physical or mechanical, they are called `virtual’ links or `hyperlinks’.

Questions: In image analysis, this part refers to objects represented within the image, which may signify to us because of, for example, their symbolic power or because of their composition in relation to each other.
Explanation: Content refers to objects represented within the image. Treatment in image analysis refers to those primary signs, often part of the technique of photography, which are about how the image is made.

Questions: A dedicated website for providing specialized information in a particular field.
Explanation: Web directory is a dedicated website for providing specialized information in a particular field. Such directories are useful for educational purpose.

Questions: _____ are the web-based interactive applications to express and share your ideas and thoughts with interested people.
Explanation: Blogs are the web-based interactive applications to express and share your ideas and thoughts with interested people. It is an open platform that can be used as on-line diaries, a journal, or editorial.

Questions: A term used in the context of web design to suggest the path that user takes while browsing a website.
Explanation: Navigation is a term used in the context of web design to suggest the path that user takes while browsing a website.

Questions: HMD stands for?
Explanation: It stands for Head Mounted Display. A kind of stereo display with two miniature screens and depth perception.

Questions: _____________ keep track of position
Explanation: Motion trackers keep track of position. Other devices are like head trackers and body trackers.

Questions: BOOM stands for?
Explanation: vBOOM stands for Binocular Omni-Orientation Monitor. It is a type of Stereoscopic display. Guidance of the box by the users.

Questions: A term for Illusion of immersion by projecting stereo images on the walls and floor of a room.
Explanation: CAVE is the term. CAVE stands for Cave Automatic Virtual Environment.

Questions: It is a mediated environment which creates the sensation in a user of being present in a (physical) surrounding.
Explanation: VR or virtual reality is a mediated environment which creates the sensation in a user of being present in a (physical) surrounding.

Questions: A term to describe the extent to which a user can modify form and content of a mediated environment.
Explanation: Interactivity is the extent to which a user can modify form and content of a mediated environment. It comprises speed and mapping.

Questions: A type of VR environment in which subjects are visually isolated from the real environment.
Explanation: In immersive VR, subjects are visually isolated from the real environment. A virtual scene is responding to the subjects actions.

Questions: In this type of VR environment, the three-dimensional scene is considered as a part of the physical environment.
Explanation: This happens in non-immersive Virtual environment. Also, the subjects do fully respond in the real environment.

Questions: In this type of VR environment, the subjects can perform both in the real and virtual environment.
Explanation: The subjects perceive a strong involvement into the VE. Also, the subjects may perform less in the real environment.

Questions: ____________is basically a form of pictorial presentation.
Explanation: Animation is basically a form of pictorial presentation. It has become the most prominent feature of technology-based learning environments.

Questions: It refers to simulated motion pictures showing movement of drawn objects.
Explanation: It refers to simulated motion pictures showing movement of drawn objects. Animation is a form of pictorial presentation.

Questions: A ____________(invented by Paul Roget in 1828) is a simple mechanical toy which creates the illusion of movement.
Explanation: A thaumatrope (invented by Paul Roget in 1828) is a simple mechanical toy. It creates the illusion of movement. Thaumatrope means “wonder turner”.

Questions: A device produces an illusion of movement from a rapid succession of static pictures.
Explanation: In 1843, William Horner, a British mathematician invented the zoetrope. A zoetrope produces an illusion of movement from a rapid succession of static pictures.

Questions: The ____________ is a piece of equipment designed to make cartoons more realistic and enjoyable. It uses stacked panes of glass each with different elements of the animation.
Explanation: Walt Disney had a problem with creating realistic animation and how to conserve time while creating it. Hence, they came up with a great solution which can be considered another innovation in the field of animation called the multiplane camera.

Questions: He made the first animated film in 1906.
Explanation: J. Stuart Blackton made the first animated film in 1906. Humorous Phases of Funny Faces was the first animation film.

Questions: Name of the first animation film.
Explanation: Humorous Phases of Funny Faces was the first animation film made by J. Stuart Blackton. He was using a blackboard as his workplace together with chalk and an eraser as his main tools.

Questions: ________ animation is used to animate things that are smaller than life size.
Explanation: Stop motion animation is used to animate things that are smaller than life size. Willis Harold O’Brian pioneered motion picture special effects, which were perfected in stop motion.

Questions: The father of animation?
Explanation: J. Stuart Blackton made the first animated film in 1906. The film was entitled Humorous Phases of Funny Faces, and with this, he became known as the father of animation.

Questions: A term in computer terminology is a change in technology a computer is/was being used.
Explanation: Generation in computer terminology is a change in technology a computer is/was being used. The term is used to distinguish between various hardware technologies.

Questions: The generation based on VLSI microprocessor.
Explanation: The 4th gen was VLSI microprocessor based. The period of fourth generation: 1972-1990.

Questions: _____ generation of computer started with using vacuum tubes as the basic components.
Explanation: First generation of computer started with using vacuum tubes as the basic components for memory and circuitry for CPU(Central Processing Unit).

Questions: Batch processing was mainly used in this generation.
Explanation: Batch processing was mainly used in the 1st generation. In this generation Punched cards, Paper tape, Magnetic tape Input & Output device were used.

Questions: _________ is an emerging branch in computer science, which interprets means and method of making computers think like human beings.
Explanation: AI is an emerging branch in computer science, which interprets means and method of making computers think like human beings.

Questions: ULSI stands for?
Explanation: Under Lower Scale Integration

Questions: In this generation Time sharing, Real time, Networks, Distributed Operating System was used.
Explanation: The fourth generation of computers is marked by the use of Very Large Scale Integrated (VLSI) circuits. In this generation Time sharing, Real time, Networks, Distributed Operating System was used.

Questions: HLL stands for?
Explanation: High Level Language(HLL) has languages like FORTRAN, COBOL. HLL isn’t in machine language. It is converted to machine language for further processing.

Questions: The period of ________ generation was 1952-1964.
Explanation: The period of the 2nd generation is 1952-1964. The period of the first generation was 1942-1954.

Questions: Execution of several activities at the same time.
Explanation: Execution of several activities at the same time is referred to as parallel processing. Like, Two multiplications at the same time on 2 different processes.

Questions: A term for simultaneous access to a resource, physical or logical.
Explanation: Concurrency is the term used for the same. When several things are accessed simultaneously, the job is said to be concurrent.

Questions: __________ leads to concurrency.
Explanation: Parallelism leads naturally to Concurrency. For example, Several processes trying to print a file on a single printer.

Questions: A parallelism based on increasing processor word size.
Explanation: Bit level parallelism is based on increasing processor word size. It focuses on hardware capabilities for structuring.

Questions: A type of parallelism that uses micro architectural techniques.
Explanation: Instructional level uses micro architectural techniques. It focuses on program instructions for structuring.

Questions: MIPS stands for?
Explanation: MIPS stands for Millions of Instructions/sec. MIPS is a way to measure the cost of computing.

Questions: The measure of the “effort” needed to maintain efficiency while adding processors.
Explanation: The measure of the “effort” needed to maintain efficiency while adding processors is called as scalabilty.

Questions: The rate at which the problem size need to be increased to maintain efficiency.
Explanation: Isoefficiency is the rate at which the problem size need to be increased to maintain efficiency.

Questions: Several instructions execution simultaneously in ________________
Explanation: In parallel processing, the several instructions are executed simultaneously.

Questions: RMI stands for?
Explanation: The RMI (Remote Method Invocation) is an API that provides a mechanism to create distributed applications.

Questions: A typical _________ program creates some remote objects, makes references to these objects accessible, and waits for clients to invoke methods on these objects.
Explanation: A server program creates remote objects. It gives reference to these objects and then waits for clients to invoke methods on these objects.

Questions: A typical __________ program obtains a remote reference to one or more remote objects on a server and then invokes methods on them.
Explanation: A client program obtains a remote reference to one or more remote objects on a server. It then invokes methods on them.

Questions: The ___________ layer, which provides the interface that client and server application objects use to interact with each other.
Explanation: The stub or skeleton layer provides the interface that client and server application objects use for interaction with each other.

Questions: A layer which is the binary data protocol layer.
Explanation: The transport protocol layer is the binary data protocol that sends remote object requests over the wire. A client is any remote application that communicates with these server objects.

Questions: A middleware layer between the stub skeleton and transport.
Explanation: The remote reference layer is the middleware between the stub/skeleton layer and underlying transport protocol.

Questions: An object acting as a gateway for the client side.
Explanation: The stub is an object that acts as a gateway for the client side. The outgoing requests are passed through the stub.

Questions: A gateway for the server side object.
Explanation: The skeleton is an object, acts as a gateway for the server side object. All the incoming requests are routed through it.

Questions: RMI uses stub and skeleton for communication with the ________ object.
Explanation: RMI uses stub and skeleton object for communication with the remote object. A remote object is an object whose method can be invoked from another JVM.

Questions: ____________ is a paradigm of distributed computing to provide the customers on-demand, utility based computing service.
Explanation: Cloud computing is a paradigm of distributed computing to provide the customers with on-demand, utility based computing services. Cloud users can provide more reliable, available and updated services to their clients in turn.

Questions: Which of the following is not a cloud stakeholder?
Explanation: There are three types of stakeholders cloud providers, cloud users and the end users.

Questions: These cloud services are of the form of utility computing i.e. the _________ uses these services pay-as-you-go model.
Explanation: The cloud users use these services pay-as-you-go model. The cloud users develop their product using these services and deliver the product to the end users.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of cloud?
Explanation: There is no protected cloud. There are three types of cloud-private, public and hybrid.

Questions: In this type of cloud, an organization rents cloud services from cloud providers on-demand basis.
Explanation: This happens in public cloud. Services are provided to the users using utility computing model.

Questions: In this type of cloud, the cloud is composed of multiple internal or external cloud.
Explanation: The hybrid cloud is composed of multiple internal or external clouds. This is the scenario when an organization moves to public cloud computing domain from its internal private cloud.

Questions: __________ enables the migration of the virtual image from one physical machine to another.
Explanation: Virtualization enables the migration of the virtual image from one physical machine to another. This feature is useful for cloud as by data locality lots of optimization is possible.

Questions: Most of the cloud architectures are built on this type of architecture.
Explanation: Most of the cloud architectures are built on Grid architecture. Grid is a type of distributed computing architecture where organizations owning data centers collaborate with each other to have common benefits.

Questions: Saas stands for?
Explanation: SAAS is Software as a service. It delivers a single application through the web browser to thousands of customers using a multitenant architecture.

Questions: Which of the following is not a type of computer on the basis of operation?
Explanation:
There are three types of computers basically on the basis of operation:
Analog, Digital and Hybrid.

Questions: A computer that operates on digital data
Explanation: The digital computer uses binary number system in which there are only two digits 0 and 1. Each one is called a bit.

Questions: This type of computer is mostly used for automatic operations.
Explanation: Hybrid computer is mostly used with automatic operations of complicated physical processes and the machines.

Questions: _____________ are used for solving complex application such as Global Weather Forecasting.
Explanation: Super computers are used with complex applications like Global Weather Forecasting, Creating graphic images, engineering design and testing, space exploration, etc.

Questions: The invention of _______________ gave birth to the much cheaper micro computers.
Explanation: The invention of microprocessor (also called as single chip CPU) gave birth to the much cheaper microcomputers.

Questions: They can operate on batteries and hence are very popular with travelers.
Explanation: Laptops can operate on batteries and hence are very popular with travelers. The screen folds down onto the keyboard when not in use.

Questions: PDA stands for?
Explanation: personal digital applications

Questions: PDAs are also called?
Explanation: PDAs are also called as Personal Digital Assistants. They are small and can be carried anywhere.

Questions: _____computers are lower to mainframe computers in terms of speed and storage capacity.
Explanation:
The answer is a. Mini computers are compared to mainframe computers in terms of:
1. speed and, 2. storage capacity.

Questions: A network of physical objects or things embedded with electronics or softwares.\
Explanation: IoT is a network of physical objects or things embedded with electronics or softwares. Iot allows objects to be controlled remotely across existing network.

Questions: RFID stands for?
Explanation: Random frequency identificationRandom frequency identificationvvvvv

Questions: Which of the following is not involved in working of IoT?
Explanation: IoT works from RFID to Sensor, to Smart tech and then to Nano tech.

Questions: Making the smaller and smaller things have the ability to connect and interact.
Explanation: Nano Tech is the term used when smaller things are made to interact and communicate. It is involved in the working of Iot also.

Questions: Wi-Fi stands for?
Explanation: Wi-Fi stands for Wireless Fidelity. It is widely used in both outdoor and indoor environments.

Questions: Diagnostics service for Cars.
Explanation: Autobot is a diagnostics service for cars. This service is integrated with several web services.

Questions: The father of ioT.
Explanation: Kevin Ashton is the father of IoT. He believed IoT could turn the world into data.

Questions: Collect->Communicate->__________->Act
Explanation:
The correct option is analyze. This shows the lifecycle of IoT.
Collect->Communicate->Analyze->Act.

Questions: Several instructions execution simultaneously in?
Explanation: In parallel processing, the several instructions are executed simultaneously. Parallel processing system provides the concurrent data processing to increase the execution time.

Questions: The technology that has the ability to interact with the world.
Explanation: AI which is artificial intelligence is the ability to interact with the world. It is the ability to model the world and to learn and adapt.

Questions: The first neural network computer.
Explanation: SNARC was the first neural network computer. it was built by Minsky and Edmonds in 1956.

Questions: A hardware based system that has autonomy, social ability and reactivity.
Explanation: The answer is Autonomous Agent. Autonomous agent has autonomy i.e. ability to operate without the direct intervention of humans or others.

Questions: A particular system that contains intelligent agents.
Explanation: It is called an agency. A particular system consisting of intelligent agents like computers or robots that cooperate to find the solution to a problem.

Questions: . A methodology used to develop behavior-based autonomous agents.
Explanation: The answer is behavior engineering. Autonomous agent implements autonomy, social ability and reactivity.

Questions: An international research effort to promote autonomous robots.
Explanation: RoboCup is designed to promote autonomous robots. It is based on multi agent collaboration.

Questions: A type of non-monotonic reasoning.\
Explanation: Default reasoning is a type of non-monotonic reasoning. Default logic is a non-monotonic logic proposed by Raymond Reiter to formalize reasoning with default assumptions.

Questions: The performance of an agent can be improved based on this.
Explanation: An AI system is designed to learn and improve. The same is implemented on its agents.

Questions: Face recognition system is based on _____________
Explanation: The answer is applied AI. It is based on applied artificial intelligence. It is an approach to develop commercially smart systems.

Questions: The field that covers a variety of computer networks, both public and private, that are used in everyday jobs.]
Explanation: Network security covers a variety of computer networks, both private and public. Everyday jobs like conducting transactions and communications among business and government agencies etc.

Questions: Which is not an objective of network security?
Explanation: The Identification, Authentication and Access control are the objectives of network security. There is no such thing called lock.

Questions: Which of these is a part of network identification?
Explanation: The answer is UserID. UserID is a part of identification. UserID can be a combination of username, user student number etc.

Questions: The process of verifying the identity of a user.
Explanation: It is called an authentication. It is typically based on passwords, smart card, fingerprint, etc.

Questions: A concern of authentication that deals with user rights.\
Explanation: Functional authorization is concerned with individual user rights. Authorization is the function of specifying access rights to resources related to information security.

Questions: CHAP stands for?
Explanation: CHAP stands for Challenge Handshake authentication protocol. Features of CHAP: plaintext, memorized token. Protocol uses Telnet, HTTP.

Questions: Security features that control that can access resources in the OS.
Explanation: Access control refers to the security features. Applications call access control to provide resources.

Questions: An algorithm in encryption is called _____________
Explanation: An algorithm used in encryption is referred to as a cipher. cipher is an algorithm for performing encryption or decryption

Questions: The information that gets transformed in encryption is ____________
Explanation: The text that gets transformed is called plain text. The algorithm used is called cipher.

Questions: The process of transforming plain text into unreadable text.]
Explanation: Encryption is the process of transforming readable text i.e. plain text to make it unreadable to anyone except those possessing special knowledge, usually referred to as a key.

Questions: A process of making the encrypted text readable again.
Explanation: The reverse process is called decryption. It is the process of making the information readable again.

Questions: WTLS stands for?
Explanation: WTLS is Wireless Transport Security Layer. It provides security between the mobile device and the WAP gateway to internet.

Questions: The protocol designed to make the security of wireless LAN as good as that of wired LAN.
Explanation: WEP stands for Wired Equivalent Privacy. WEP has been broken already in 2001. WEP protocol designed to make the security of wireless LAN as good as that of wired LAN.

Questions: A person who enjoys learning details about computers and how to enhance their capabilities.
Explanation: The person is called hacker. A person who enjoys learning the details of computer systems and how to stretch their capabilities is called hacker.

Questions: A program created by Farmer and Venema for auditing capability.
Explanation: SATAN is the Security analysis tool for auditing networks. It is created by farmer and venema.

Questions: A small program that changes the way a computer operates.
Explanation: The program is called virus. It alters the way that the computer operates. It often does damages like deleting and corrupting files and data.

Questions: A program that copies itself.
Explanation: A worm copies itself from one system to another over a network without the assistance of human.

Questions: An attack in which the site is not capable of answering valid request.
Explanation: The answer is Denial of service. In case of denial of service attacks, a computer site is bombarded with a lot of messages.

Questions: A cipher in which the order is not preserved.
Explanation: In transposition-based cipher, the order of the plain text is not preserved. They can be very simple to identify.

Questions: A unique piece of information that is used in encryption
Explanation: The key is the unique piece of information. It is used to create the cipher text and decrypt it back.

Questions: Study of creating a d using encryption and decryption techniques.
Explanation: It is called as cryptography. It is the study of creating and using the encryption techniques.

Questions: Creating a computer or paper audit that can help detect wrong doings.
Explanation: The answer is auditing. It is done to keep an eye on wrong doings. Auditing can be used as a deterrent.

Questions: An indirect form of surveillance.
Explanation: Honey pot is an indirect form of surveillance. Network personnel create a trap, watching for unscrupulous acts.

Questions: A malicious code hidden inside a seemingly harmless piece of code.
Explanation: The answer is Trojan horse. Trojan horse is a code that is present in a program that appears harmless.

Questions: Attack in which a user creates a packet that appears to be something else.
Explanation: The attack is a spoofing attack. It is when a user creates a packet that appears to be something else or from someone else.

Questions: A technique in which a program attacks a network by exploiting IP broadcast addressing operations.
Explanation: Smurfing is a technique in which a program attacks a network by exploiting IP broadcast addressing operations.

Questions: An attack in which the user receives unwanted amount of e-mails.
Explanation: In the case of denial of e-mail bombing, a user sends an excessive amount of unwanted e-mail to someone.

Questions: These ciphers replace a character or characters with a different character or characters, based on some key.
Explanation: In mono alphabetic substitution-based cipher, a character is replaced with some other character or multiple characters, based on some key.

Questions: A type of cipher that uses multiple alphabetic strings.
Explanation: These ciphers are similar to that of mono alphabetic ciphers. Multiple strings are used to encode the plain text.

Questions: An encryption technique with 2 keys is ______________
Explanation: It is called as public key cryptography. It has 2 keys: a private key and a public key.

Questions: In public key cryptography, a key that decrypts the message.
Explanation: Public key cryptography has 2 keys. They are private key and a public key. The public key encrypts the message. The private key decrypts the message.

Questions: DES stands for?
Explanation: DES stands for Data Encryption Standard. It was created in 1977 and went into operation from 1990s.

Questions: Under DES, the data encryption standard took a 64-bit block of data and subjected it to ______ levels of encryption.
Explanation: The answer is 16. It was subjected to 16 levels of encryption. DES is the data encryption standard.

Questions: Triple-DES has ______ keys.
Explanation: There are 2 keys in triple DES as well. The private and the public key. It can also have 3 unique keys.

Questions: Encryption standard that is selected by the US government to replace DES.
Explanation: AES is Advanced Encryption Standard. It was selected by the US government. It is used to replace DES.

Questions: An electronic document that establishes your credentials when you are performing transactions.
Explanation: Digital certificate is an electronic document that is responsible for secure internet transactions.

Questions: A field of technology that deals with a combination of real world and the data generated from computer.
Explanation: AR that is Augmented Reality is a field of technology that deals with a combination of real world and the data generated from computer.

Questions: Technologies that completely involve a user inside a synthetic environment.
Explanation: The answer is VR or Virtual Reality. VR technologies are known for immersing a user inside a synthetic environment. While immersed, the user cannot see the real world around him.

Questions: Technologies that allow the user to see the real world, with virtual objects composited in the real world.\
Explanation: Augmented Reality (AR) allows a user to see real world, with virtual objects superimposed or composited with the real world.

Questions: A ______________________ is a display device, worn on head as a part of helmet that has a small display optic.
Explanation: HMD is the head-mounted display, worn on head as a part of helmet that has a small display optic. HTC Vive, Samsung GearVR are examples of HMDs available today.

Questions: Wearable computing device in the form of computerized eyeglasses.
Explanation: Smart glasses are also called as optical head mounted displays. (OHMD), it has the capability of reflecting projected images as well as allowing users to see through it.

Questions: A tracking based on geo-location information.
Explanation: Location based tracking is based on geo-location information obtained from device’s location sensors. (Longitude, latitude, altitude etc).

Questions: SLAM stands for?
Explanation: SLAM is abbreviated for Simultaneous localization and mapping. It is a technique used by robots and autonomous vehicles to build a map within the unknown environment.

Questions: A technique that enables light field which is generally the product of a light source scattered off objects.
Explanation: Holography enables a light field. It is to be recorded and later reconstructed when the original light field is no longer present.

Questions: A _______ can be recorded using a normal light source.
Explanation: A photograph can be captured using a normal light source. A laser is required to record a hologram.

Questions: A model that is the demo implementation of the system.
Explanation: Prototype is the demo implementation so that the customer gets a brief idea of his product. It is generally used when the customer requirements are not clear.

Questions: A stage in which individual components are integrated and ensured that they are error-free to meet customer requirements.
Explanation: Hardware and software components are tested individually. Testing stage in which individual components are integrated and ensured that they are error-free to meet customer requirements.

Questions: ________ is a step in which design is translated into machine-readable form.
Explanation: Coding is the step in which design in translated into machine-readable form. If design is efficient, coding can be done effectively.

Questions: The customer requirements are broken down into logical modules for ease of _______________
Explanation: The requirements are broken down for ease of implementation. Hardware and software requirements are identified and designed accordingly.

Questions: What do you call a technical person who is capable of understanding the basic requirements?
Explanation: The person is called an analyst. An analyst is a software engineering who is responsible for requirements gathering.

Questions: A step in waterfall model that involves a meeting with the customer to understand the requirements.
Explanation: A waterfall model involves requirement gathering as its first step. This is the most important phase. It is important to understand the customer requirements.

Questions: Methodology in which project management processes were step-by step.
Explanation: Waterfall model is based on step-by step completion of the project. Every step is done individually.

Questions: An individual who plans and directs the work.
Explanation: Project planner is the one who plans and designs the project. Team leader is the one who provides guidance, instruction, direction and leadership to a group of individuals.

Questions: A planned program if work that requires a definitive amount of time, effort and planning to complete.
Explanation: The answer is Project. A project is a program which is something which is planned and needs effort and time to complete.

Questions: A set of activities that ensure that software correctly implements a specific function.
Explanation: Verification ensures that software correctly implements a specific function. It is a static practice of verifying documents.

Questions: _______ is done in the development phase by the debuggers.
Explanation: Coding is done by the developers. In debugging, the developer fixes the bug in the development phase. Testing is conducted by the testers.

Questions: Locating or identifying the bugs is known as ___________
Explanation: Testing is conducted by the testers. They locate or identify the bugs. In debugging developer fixes the bug. Coding is done by the developers.

Questions: Which defines the role of software?
Explanation: The answer is system engineering. System engineering defines the role of software.

Questions: What do you call testing individual components?
Explanation: The testing strategy is called unit testing. It ensures a function properly works as a unit.

Questions: A testing strategy that test the application as a whole.
Explanation: Validation testing tests the application as a whole against the user requirements. In system testing, it tests the application in the context of an entire system.

Questions: A testing strategy that tests the application in the context of an entire system.
Explanation: In system testing, it tests the application in the context of an entire system. The software and other system elements are tested as a whole.

Questions: A ________ is tested to ensure that information properly flows into and out of the system.
Explanation: A module interface is tested to ensure that information properly flows into and out of the system.

Questions: A testing conducted at the developer’s site under validation testing.
Explanation: Alpha testing is conducted at developer’s site. It is conducted by customer in developer’s presence before software delivery.

Questions: A ______________ represents the need of information in the program without the presenting the details.
Explanation: Abstraction is a concept that involves hiding the details and giving only the necessary information to the user. It increases the power of a programming language.

Questions: The process of forming a new class from an existing class.
Explanation: The answer is inheritance. The base class is the parent class and the new class is called the child class.

Questions: This concept allows routines to use data again at different times.
Explanation: Polymorphism is a concept in OOP wherein different functions can be used again at different times.

Questions: The ability for programmers to use the same written and debugged existing class.
Explanation: The programmer can add features to the existing class. The programmer on further developing the application, and allowing users to achieve increased performance.

Questions: A concept that combines data and functions into a single unit called class.
Explanation: Encapsulation enables the important concept of data hiding possible. It combines data and functions into a single unit.

Questions: ________ represents a particular instance of a class.
Explanation: An object is an instance of the class. The data members are accessed with the help of objects.

Questions: A basic unit of object-oriented programming.
Explanation: In OOP, the basic unit is an object. Objects are identified by its unique name.

Questions: A procedural programming follows ___________ approach.
Explanation: A procedural programming follows top-down approach. The main focus is on the functions. It has a lot of global variable.

Questions: A programming technique in which the focus is on doing things.
Explanation: In procedural programming, the focus is on doing things(functions). It follows top-down approach.
